job_desc: Oversee end-to-end implementation of several global portfolio projects focusing on the interactions between call centre agents and customers, facilitating an overall great customer experience Lead the coordination of resources, project scope, business requirement documentation, project documentation, project status reporting, project risk management, timelines, project communication, change management as well as postimplementation audit reviews Oversee all aspects of the project including business requirements documentation, stakeholder analysis, timelines, budgets, resource allocation, scope, definition and project communication
job_req: Min 5 years of BA/PM experience in eCommerce or relevant industry 3-5 years of working experience in process design and documentation A proven track record of successfully leading multiple concurrent projects of medium to large scope Ability to use data and analysis to support process flows and to influence others Proven experience gathering and writing effective Business Requirement Documentation Experience leveraging functional expertise to create a good customer experience Proven success in creating efficient business processes and willing to challenge the status quo Demonstrated ability to complete multiple tasks under pressure Drives change laterally across regions and organizations using influence skills Maintains a positive attitude Thrives in ambiguous work environment Strong team player with a high degree of flexibility 12 months contract

job_desc: Responsibilities   The successful candidate for this role will be wearing multiple hats as specified below:  Business System Analysis Development Quality Assurance Testing Project Management           Business System Analysis Responsibilities  Conduct requirements workshops with Global Remedy stakeholders to identify and model business processes, and translate them into application requirements that are actionable for developers. Make recommendations and proposals for implementation of business process and customer experience. Help define and prioritize Remedy enhancements roadmap by working in collaboration with cross-functional groups including Global Network Operations, Global IBX Operations, Service Desk teams etc. Act as a subject-matter expert for Equinix's Remedy System. Collaborate with Global Remedy Business stakeholders on Remedy requirements, review globally approved BRD (Business Requirements Document) and translate them into a Functional Design Document (FDD). Responsible for writing the Function Design Document (FDD), socialize it with business stakeholders, organize meetings to perform walkthrough of FDD with the business and work with GPO team to get it globally approved. Must have experience building wireframes, documenting screenshots for developers to visualize the end-product. Socialize the FDD with Remedy Development Team and help them understand the requirements in detail and bridge any gaps. Must be willing to work with off-shore development teams on a daily basis. Hold meetings with them to explain the requirements and perform FDD walkthrough and answer any open questions. Collaborate with Development team to fix bugs and test them. Perform walkthrough with the Business on test-cases and educate them on performing UAT. Collaborate with the business on User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and drive it to closure. Work with Development Team on identifying the deployment schedule and communicate the same with the business stakeholders. Accountable for Remedy release certification ensuring highest quality and customer experience. Accountable for end-to-end functional & solution design for various custom modules on Remedy platform. Monitor support tickets queue and provide L1, L2, L3 support and troubleshoot complex Remedy issues during US Time zone. Be able to use Remedy Data Migration tool to perform data updates to the Remedy system.    Development Responsibilities  Must be able to build custom Remedy applications using Remedy forms and Remedy workflow objects (Active Links, Filters and Escalations etc.) by following best practices. Conduct and lead brainstorming design sessions with other developers for delivery of Remedy projects and enhancements. Work directly with the BMC to renew licenses and creating defects. Must perform application configuration such as adding categories, groups. Provide L1/L2/L3 support whenever necessary. Preventative maintenance, such as performance tuning, archiving. Must be able to read SQL, API, Filter, Escalation logs for troubleshooting purposes. Investigating and implementing application customization. Deploying application changes or upgrades as and when required. Strong execution in terms of backup/restore process. Execute the Remedy DR process and guide the key Remedy Admin personnel in performing the deployment steps from start to finish.  Update Remedy DR run-book at regular intervals. Be able to write XML Web Services in Remedy and have functional knowledge of Remedy API integration layer. Ability to analyze, approve and enhance current Remedy modules. Use Remedy Migrator or other data integration tools to migrate remedy objects/data and data across environments. Must have hands-on experience with SSO and LDAP Plugins for Remedy.                             Be able to integrate Remedy with other external applications using DB links, views, plsql scripts, database functions, stored procedures, complex sql queries etc. Expert in design and development of jobs to capture CDC (Change Data Capture) from source systems. Strong expertise in administration, install, configure, clustering, load balance related components of Kettle, Carte jobs for a high available environment. Must have the primary knowledge of Linux OS commands to support maintenance of Remedy application on VM. . Willingness to work with offshore team members during off hours. Ability to work under tight timelines and project milestones.    Quality Assurance Responsibilities  Work with the development and business team to fine-grain requirements and create test plans and test cases. Perform both black-box and white-box testing. Design test-cases and lead the Remedy QA team to perform testing on all the enhancements.  Well-versed with Test Plan preparation, Test Case preparation, Test Execution and consolidating test results. Expert communicator and ability to work closely with the cross-functional and the offshore team. Re-test any bugs fixed by Development team as part of the release process. Provide quality certification for all Remedy Releases. Represent the Remedy QA team in cross functional meetings. Use HP-ALM tool to manage test cases, test results, and defects. Deliver Defect reports to upper management for upcoming releases. Participate in QA team initiatives to define and improve processes.    Project Management Responsibilities  Organize weekly meetings with Remedy Business and perform project management on the dependencies, risks, current status of enhancements etc.   Prepare and share the meeting minutes with Remedy Business owners and IT stakeholders. Participate in planning and design review meetings with developers to determine schedules, review technical problems, and assign tasks and resources. Develop and manage all aspects of project engagement from planning, business relationships, communications, change, risks and issues for Remedy projects & enhancements. Deliver status decks for Remedy projects and enhancements on a weekly basis. Ensure that Remedy projects are proceeding according to scope, schedule and quality standards. Must be able to build detailed project plans (milestones + tasks) in Visio and communicate the same with Remedy team and extended business stakeholders. Collaborate with other PMO teams and represent Remedy on any cross-functional projects.
job_req: Qualifications & Experience  Must have Masters in Computer Science or equivalent with 6+ years of experience working in an agile environment with managing business requirements and hands-on delivery experience with Remedy platform. Must have  6+ years of relevant IT work experience performing requirements elicitation, writing functional specifications, converting business ideas into application requirements, performing testing and collaborating with the business end-users on enhancements roadmap, UAT testing etc. Must have 6+ years of experience writing custom Remedy applications (forms, active links, filters, escalations etc.) Must have 6+ years of experience in installing and configuring BMC Remedy and recent experience of upgrading AR Server to 8.x or 9 in a clustered high available environment. Hands-on expertise with upgrading Remedy AR Server and Remedy Mid-tier server with the latest patches. Must be able to troubleshoot application logs (SQL, API, Filter, Active Links etc.) and provide solutions. Must have 3+ years of QA experience in writing test-cases, test-plans, build defect reports, and perform white-box and black-box testing. 2+ years of working experience with HP-ALM or similar defect tracking tool. Knowledge of relational databases (Oracle), PL/SQL, DB Links, and Views etc. is a plus. Experience in writing plsql scripts, functions, stored procedures, complex sql queries, plsql analytical functions, hierarchical, parent-child queries is a strong plus. Technical aptitude and proficiency in productivity software, as well as visual information management tools (MS Office, Visio etc.) 2+ years of Project Management experience managing milestones, tasks, risks for small to mid-sized projects. Knowledge and understanding of industry tools and techniques to elicit, prioritize, organize, document, model, and analyze requirements  Knowledge of software development methodologies (Agile, Waterfall etc.) and compliance/regulatory standards. Analytical and problem solving skills including the ability to investigate, assess, and recommend solutions to moderately complex situations. Interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively interact with and influence others. Listening, verbal and written communications skills with the ability to present information to a variety of audiences. Negotiation skills with the ability to influence others through sharing information and gaining commitment. Ability to coach and help others learn knowledge or skills in a specific area. Organizational skills and the ability to pay close attention to details.  Successful Candidate will have:   Service oriented ideology with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders throughout the organization. Excellent analytical skills and creative problem solving abilities. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to advocate for solutions receive feedback and collaborate with other platform leads and architects. Excellent time management and organizational skills. Be a talent multiplier who gets the team around them to excel. Be persistent, creative and driven to get results relentlessly. Exhibit a strong backbone to challenge the status quo, when needed. Show pride of ownership and strive for excellence in everything undertaken. Exhibit a high level of curiosity, keeping abreast of the latest trends & technologies. Must be a team player with strong inter-personal skills. Must be able to work in a fast-paced team environment with minimal supervision. Must have the ability to escalate issues in a timely manner. Ability to influence and drive decision making to solve problems at different levels. Must have prior experience in leading technical deliverables.

job_desc: Senior Business Analyst will work together with customers and the Catena technical team to ensure that our software platform for trade reporting and analytics, TRACE, fully addresses customers’ business requirements . Business analysis activities will include understanding client and regulatory requirements, translating those requirements into product feature and system requirements, and collaborating with the internal development team to successfully deliver our solutions according to client needs as well as to continually improve the entire client experience. The Senior Business Analyst will also collaborate with our sales and marketing team to help achieve sales quotas and grow the company’s business.
job_req: Responsibilities  Gather, analyse and document business requirements Solicit customer feedback on product and services to identify areas of product improvement Perform data mapping to identify data gaps and work with business users to source the additional information required Work with the development team to design and develop the solution to meet the business requirements Provide business, technical, and product knowledge in support of post-sales activities in order to ensure customer satisfaction Identify and grow business opportunities with existing clients, and collaborate with sales teams to ensure growth attainment Help to review the accuracy of contracts and invoices Educate clients on existing and new product features and how those features can support their business growth Advise clients on regulatory updates  General Requirements  Bachelor or Master degree in business administration, technology-related, or similar discipline More than 5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in the financial markets business area Excellent problem solving and analytical skills  Comfortable presenting to and negotiating requirement details with customers An understanding of the trade lifecycle for major financial asset classes across securities, exchange-traded, and OTC derivatives, is desirable. Understanding of and experience in regulatory reporting is desirable  Personal Considerations  Self-directed and highly motivated individual Strong interpersonal skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Team player Ability to work under pressure

job_desc: This role is a senior Business Analyst role to document user stories and features in an agile project. The person in this role is expected to guide and mentor more junior Business Analysts within the team and to help peer review BA work. They will be expected to manage the allocation of work among themselves and other BAs working on the same project. The role is based in Singapore but regionally focused and some travel (~10%) will be required occasionally. The ideal candidate will be a self-driven, hands on person, who can work well in a team and collaborate with the scrum master, developers, testers and BAs as well as business stakeholders.  Play an active role in all phases of the project lifecycle:  encompassing feasibility, planning, analysis & design, development, testing, UAT, change management & training and end-user support. Work with local business stakeholders to elicit, scope and define high level business requirements in line with the business vision. Define, plan and execute a structured approach to:   Requirements analysis ensuring high level business requirements are effectively translated into a complete & prioritised set of high level system changes Systems analysis & design, working with the offshore delivery team & business stakeholder to identify and document a complete and fully articulated set of detailed system requirements.   Ensure business stakeholders are informed and across the system design throughout the SDLC Defect triage and prioritisation Help business to define an UAT Framework and provide hands-on support for UAT logistics & execution Review and understand business processes and propose alternative processes/solutions where required
job_req: • Experience working in a General Insurance company, and ideally in a Commercial Insurance business • Practical experience of estimating and detailed planning of analysis work streams and reporting against plan • Experience documenting user stories and features in agile projects • Experience in system/product rollout projects • Detailed knowledge of the system development lifecycle & the appropriate BA methods and techniques required - complex requirement analysis and use of structure analysis frameworks • Experience working on projects with strong and well defined A&D methodology or track record of identifying and introducing improvements • Experience of using initiative to overcome roadblocks and effectively meet desired outcome in challenging circumstances • Understand the test process and the link with requirements • Ability to complete Business Specifications, Use Cases, Functional Specifications, Workflow Diagrams, Gap Analysis, Business Case, and ROI Analysis documents, as required. • Be a strong communicator able to work with a variety of business and IT personnel • Have a strong stakeholder management skill set – someone who can take the lead with the business rather than be led • Ideally is familiar with MOSCOW prioritisation • Practical experience of working with remote teams in a multi-site environment with previous exposure to remote programming teams

job_desc: About Bank of America Merrill Lynch:  Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 40 countries. In the U.S alone, we serve almost all Fortune 500 companies and approximately 59 million consumers and small-business customers. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.                              Connecting Asia Pacific to the World Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 23 offices in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is committed to attracting, recruiting and retaining top diverse talent from across the globe. Our diversity and inclusion mission is to actively promote an inclusive work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve personal success and contribute to the growth of our business. Each of our global Employee Networks bring together employees, create dialogue and awareness in support of our Diversity and Inclusion mission. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is an equal opportunities employer. Position Description Background: GMOT Collateral Technology Team in Singapore is responsible for delivering global projects for Collateral Operations teams across various locations in addition to managing the APAC business relationship. The team participates in global projects delivery and is directly responsible for ensuring regional specific requirements are taken care. The team liaises with a number of technology teams both within and outside of the collateral tech teams across US, UK and India. We are looking for a senior project manager cum subject matter expert to work on a number of strategic initiatives to bring the collateral business processes across multiple lines of businesses onto a single platform. Key Responsibilities  Have at least 8+ years of experience as a BA in the end to end collateral management business processes across multiple lines of businesses; Be able to demonstrate strong understanding of collateral management business processes such as documentation of requirements, Upstream feeds, exposures & collateral valuations, Initial Margin & Variation Margin concepts, Margin call calculations & processing, Disputes management process, Portfolio Reconciliation, Downstream feeds, Regulatory & Metrics Reporting and Regulatory / Legal / Compliance Requirements; Be able to grasp the changes required to the current business processes and write excellent business requirement documents; Be able to coordinate with business users and other stakeholders across locations; Be a strong project manager and self-starter
job_req: Key Requirements  Strong business knowledge of collateral business processes Strong Project Management skills MS Office / Power Point Presentation skills Testing experience Excellent communication skills
comp: ALEXANDER MANN BPO SOLUTIONS (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.

job_desc: Your primary focus will be on transformative concept of operations, business requirements and functional specifications of a Whole-of-Government (WOG) Digitalised Governance Platform to level up ICT&SS governance capability consistently across WOG and to achieve economies of scale and cost-efficiency.   What to Expect:    Participate in the service mapping sessions, requirements gathering and contribute to the development of the transformative concept of operations, business requirements and functional/design specifications   Co-develop the tender specifications   Actively analyse and validate business requirements   Evaluate and recommend solutions that best address the needs   Develop the validation and acceptance criteria with users to ensure acceptance of the new system   Review system testing, integration testing and data conversion documents to verify that specifications are met   Drive a smooth deployment, implementation and operations of the system   Work with awarded tenderer to understand and troubleshoot technical problems, as needed   Undertake root cause analysis for problems in order to implement preventive and corrective measures to meet business and performance needs   Proactive, quality-conscious, results-oriented and thrives under pressure in a fast-paced and dynamic environment   Able to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges   Able to facilitate discussions/workshops to elicit, manage and prioritise key business needs   A team player with strong influencing and people handling skills, possess excellent communication, stakeholder engagement and presentation skills.    How to Succeed:    Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information/Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related discipline. Those without a degree but has relevant experience or expertise may also apply.   Minimum 10 years of relevant experience in software development life cycle, preferably in Enterprise Technology Risk, Audit and Compliance management area.   Proven experience in IT business analysis, application solutioning, design and testing   Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders   Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem solving skills   An advantage if applicant has worked in a Government agency before and has knowledge of Instruction Manual (IM) for ICT, undergone audits and understand the government processes in the submissions of agency ICT rolling plans, funding requests, tracking & reporting of agency project portfolio.   Having completed at least 2 large scale application projects (such as at WOG level or for large banking or multinational corporation for at least at regional level)

job_desc: Job Objectives Define detailed functional and technical requirements involving personal finance management and real time customer engagement for mobile banking application and ensure traceability Lead and collaborate with cross-functional and technical teams including technical analysts, solution architect and technical teams, testing teams and other Host technical teams to define requirements Work effectively with the business users and with the internal IT and Security Teams to ensure all aspects of the business requirement and defined and analysed Engage effectively and regularly with senior stakeholders through scope governance meetings, ensuring the support of senior management
job_req: Define and document business functions and processes, functional requirements Define and document API or Webservices to be consumed by the mobile applications or web channels Consult with business users to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, currentoperational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access Act as a liaison between departmental end-users, technical analysts, information technology analysts, consultants and other IT teams in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of the system to achieve optimal operational performance and quality Analyse the feasibility of, and develop requirements for, systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the functional design fits the needs of the users Track and fully document changes for functional and business specifications; write detailed universally understood processes/steps/requirements for use in training Identify opportunities for improving business processes, user interface, functionality through information systems and/or non-system driver changes; assist in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes. Work with multi-vendor teams to define and analyse requirements; perform impact analysis for enhancements Assist the project team in issue resolution to meet the requirements and timelines Define the training materials, and conduct formal system and user training sessions; facilitate train-the-trainer approach Assist in training/mentoring other staff on the project Anticipate, analyze, address and resolve any functional or non-functional issues or risks either independently or together with the relevant stakeholders and propose alternative solutions as necessary Estimate cost, and prepare business cases for IT solutions, considering infrastructure, licenses, development and support Interested candidates please send across your resume to hr@xploreinfocomz.com.Refernce is also appreciated Cheers Human Resource hr@xploreinfocomz.com Registration ID:R1769680 EA License Number:18S9214

job_desc: The Team  The Technology team is at the core of what we do, enabling and evolving our systems and capabilities, and designing for our future. We work across multiple technical platforms both externally and internally, and are looking to add to the team to better serve our internal clients and planning & design.  Primary Activities  Gather and analyse business requirements and processes, and document requirements clearly Assess the feasibility and impact of business requirements on integration of all relevant systems and work with relevant teams on appropriate integration solution Conduct system functionality testing and work with users on user acceptance testing Manage issues and drive them to closure in a timely manner, escalating issues and risks wherever necessary Work with developers to ensure that deliverables are on track Assist in developing acceptance testing and user training plans to ensure the quality of product and smooth implementation Maintain the Technology BoK as per the established in-house processes
job_req: Qualifications, Skills & Experience  Minimum 2 years of Business Analyst experience in delivering customer facing platforms Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical personnel Good documentation skills, including activity, use case and process flow diagrams Knowledge ITIL and tools like Smartsheet, Jira and Confluence Experience working with remote teams in an Agile environment is a plus Experience with SalesForce and/or in the financial/loan industry is a plus

job_desc: The Reuters News Agency licenses Reuters’ news and services to the news industry. Our customers are broadcasters, print and digital publishers, corporations and governments. Reuters News Agency provides its clients with multi-media news solutions to reach their audiences.  Our products include video & text feeds, pictures & graphics, packaged content and syndication services which reach billions of consumers around the world. The Reuters News Agency Product team is looking for energetic and focused individuals with 2-4 years of relevant experience. Candidates should possess excellent communication skills and strong analytical ability. They should be willing to learn and explore, be eager to work with others and have the right attitude to be a team player. Candidates with a background in statistics/programming are preferred. Knowledge of or experience in media would be an added plus.   Description: The candidate will primarily be responsible for studying customer usage patterns on our media products, establishing benchmarks, analyzing trends and making recommendation to Proposition Heads on product and content usage.  The candidate will work with internal and external stakeholders in order to ensure product decisions are made based on business and market intelligence and  recommend solutions to enable Reuters to achieve its strategic goals and revenue expectations:  Underpin product decisions with qualitative and quantitative data, creating actionable intelligence and insight Market sizing to ensure that we are capitalizing on growth opportunities, especially Asia and emerging markets Executive Dashboarding, Scorecarding, KPI Reporting Ad hoc analysis to investigate business performance/trends Developing customer insights to drive acquisition, retention and cross/upsell strategies Brief relevant stakeholders on the development of new products for the portfolio in close collaboration with the Design Lead and Project Lead in the Core team. Define price points, distribution channels and revenue targets Can identify, assess and review data with a view to presenting strategic insights to management He/she should have a keen eye to spot data irregularities and perform ongoing data sanity checks Be efficient at analyzing a brief/new requirements, build a process and deliver solutions
job_req: Required skills and Education:  Degree required (background in statistics/math/economics is preferred) Demonstrable interest in or experience with news media Excellent communication skills Should possess good analytical skills Intermediate MS Excel skills (pivots, charts etc.) Knowledge of data visualization tools is a plus but not mandatory (for e.g. Tableau) Ability to conceptualize and build templates to represent data Familiarity with SQL is a plus as is some programming knowledge

job_desc: Job Descriptions  Understand clients' business functions and objectives so as to propose appropriate and efficient solutions. Conceptualize and Design user friendly interface. Prepare detail specifications, design documents and test cases. Manage scope of work and project schedule based on the agreed timeline committed to clients. Monitor entire SDLC development. Train clients on the ERP software solutions discussed and developed for them. Make sure successful live run of all clients assigned. Carry out post implementation support.
job_req: Requirements  Degree from Computer Science or System Information, Accounting or Business Studies Strong interest in ERP solutions, e.g. Project Costing, Supply Chain Management, and Payroll. Good communication in both English and Mandarin to liaise with associates. Keen interest in Project Implementation and Management. Good Inter-personal communication skill. Proactive, highly self-motivated, result oriented and can work independently. Must be very Customer Oriented. Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks.

job_desc: Workato is looking for Business Analysts to be the vital link between our information technology capacity and business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our internal processes. For a glimpse into what a Business Analyst does in Workato, refer to our Inside Workato’s Kitchen ebook, which includes projects and processes that our team has accomplished internally over the past year. Responsibilities   Work across all functional areas and with management in Workato to develop sound business processes and identify automation opportunities in these processes.   Manage and implement projects that help coordinate and integrate the flow of critical business data through multiple functional areas and applications. This may include assessing and procuring applications for internal use and building new connections to those applications through APIs.   Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of applications and processes used internally, from gathering and documenting requirements to implementation and handling ongoing improvements to them.   Documentation of processes, applications and integrations used; educate users on the best practices of these processes   Develop comprehensive management reporting capabilities by using data from multiple sources and visualising to gather insights on these data.   Application instructions: To apply, please fill up the application form at https://grnh.se/1b0cfb4d2

job_desc: Job Descriptions and Responsibilities:  Take the lead in interacting with team and clients/users as a business requirement problem-solver. Gather, analyse and formalise user’s business requirements and processes, evaluate on feasibility of implementation and manage scope of project. Work with project manager and sales to prepare documentations for projects needs. Work with development and project implementer to make sure the development is inline with the signed off requirement. Produce sprint deliverables in a short period of time and validate. Help to maintain a steady backlog of requirements that are ready to go into sprints for the Scrum team.   Contribute in daily stand-up, iteration planning, sprint review, and iteration retrospective. Able to do post mortem and root cause analysis to help teams continuously improve their practices to ensure maximum productivity. Present and validate the sprint deliverable solution and potentials estimated savings via mockup demos with the different stakeholders involved. Prepare Test Case and manage testing to ensure the delivery quality. Assist in the integration testing, system testing, User Acceptance Test & implementation activities. Prepare user manual and operations manual, and plan - facilitate the training of users and operators Conduct requirement gathering sessions. Conduct a gap analysis of the current business process to identify improvement opportunities.  Essential Technical Knowledge/Skills:    Functional knowledge Strong understanding of SDLC and Agile Methodology Business Analysis Quality Control and Testing Agile Methodology Financial/Monetary/HR/Payroll/Education Topics SDLC  Technical skills:     Data Modeling Testing Process / Automated Testing Tools (if any) Develop simple database

Experience in creating simple database, tooling to facilitate mockup demo. Deep understanding of agile metrics (user stories, tasks, backlog tracking, burndown metrics) to analyze and improve sprint planning. Good knowledge of Application Development, Maintenance, Production and Support practices. General knowledge of IT Governance processes and frameworks such as COBIT or ITIL. Experience in implementing Human Resource Management Software. Strong ability to understand the stakes and benefits of an IT-APM initiative. Understanding of Application and Technical Architecture challenges and dependencies. Ability to understand and represent both the business and development teams. Ability to collaborate with various teams in a multi -national and multi-cultural environment. (Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, China, Hong Kong) Capacity to communicate with Management in a deliverable-oriented mindset. Understanding of Financial/Monetary/HR/Payroll/Education topics, basic knowledge of management accounting is a plus.

job_req: JOB PURPOSE   As a Business Analyst within Financial Markets Regulatory programme, you will be involved in critical regulatory projects, working in a dynamic global team with software engineers, other project managers, business stakeholders, Operational partners and other technical experts globally.     KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Perform in-depth analysis around key requirements of the project and regulatory changes (Trade Reporting Regulatory projects). Work with technology teams to design the reconciliation solution and process, implement the reconciliation tool into SCB architecture. Articulate the Scope / requirements in standard documents/process flow diagrams/use case diagrams etc to secure signoff from stakeholders. Participation in industry forums / calls and interpretation of new regulations or changes to existing regulations. Conduct meetings and relevant discussions to engage stakeholders in the right perspective and take the requirements/ specifications to closure. Manage relationships with key stakeholders both internal (Legal, Compliance, other tech teams, Transaction Reporting teams) and external (DTCC, Industry calls, Regulators etc). Identify risks & issues and communicate them to the relevant people/ PM in a timely manner – assist with proposing & planning mitigating steps. Determine Strategic Solutions / Proposals – focusing on long term efficiency, risk reduction and regulatory compliance Maintain a culture of risk awareness and proactive resolution. Facilitates Business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications Co-ordinate and manage the delivery of the project across FMO, IT and relevant FO teams Provide solutions as well as produce clear and unambiguous functional specifications for development team. Use appropriate tools like JIRA, WIKI etc to ensure that Functional Specifications are split and managed with development team in terms of clarity and implementation. Pro-actively engage, manage & build relationships with both technology (including vendors) & business stakeholders. Assist the PM with planning of BA tasks. Support the test team & business users during the testing phase by making design calls & assisting in issue analysis & resolution Support the transition to the production support team. Conduct Knowledge sharing/ staff learning program within the team Mentor junior Business Analysts to perform their roles in a better manner.    KEY MEASURABLES  Successful delivery of MIFDI II post trade regulatory change projects within Group Technology and Operations Proactive issue identification and resolution, focusing on long term objectives and improvement Strong and positive influence on direction and success of front to back regulatory reporting business change agenda, representing Regulatory Operations and Compliance Contribution to significant advances in regulatory reporting application suite Clear and appropriate communication with front to back stakeholders    KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE  Experience of back reporting on post trade reporting (EMIR/DF/MIFID) Experience of regulatory regime MIFID2 is very important, specifically ARM, APA (Bloomberg, NEX), RTS23 and Commodity Position Reporting MIFID2/MIFIR regulatory distillation experience and translation to functional requirements and solutions Good experience of managing change – both project leadership and business analysis skills Experience of OTC products & trade lifecycle aligned to industry best practice Ability to document functional solution designs of high quality with no ambiguity. Articulate requirements clearly by using graphic and workflow tools like Visio, wireframe tools etc. Ability to work proactively & independently and display initiative Pragmatic team player with an attention to detail Excellent communication and organizational skills with ability to work effectively cross department and geography Proactive and driven individual – independent thinker able to influence and motivate others. Confidence to challenge the status quo & provide alternative solutions Strong problem solving and analytical skills Experience of agile analysis & development would be advantageous Intimate knowledge of FPML, XML, FIX message

job_desc: COMPANY DESCRIPTION NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives. RESPONSIBILITIES The Analytics Centre transforms big data into actionable insights which enable the SEs to make decision that directly impact the outcomes of their business.   By identifying patterns and building models that help to interpret and predict the behaviors of different customer segments, we will uncover opportunities for partners to grow their business through more effective marketing, better product development and stronger customer engagement.  We are on the lookout for talented individuals to join us as BI / Business Analyst. This role will work very closely with the Business Insights team, which is responsible for development and delivery of Business Insights solutions to the organization. Responsibilities:  Work as part of the Analytics team to develop analytical solutions, most frequently in the form of data visualizations and interactive dashboards Create, schedule, and monitor server-based BI activities such as data extracts and refreshes Define, populate, and maintain user groups and user access within analytical tools Audit reporting performance and optimize when necessary Assist in performing and testing to deploy dashboards in production Assist in user adoption and enablement activities such as delivering training sessions or writing instructional content for BI tools Understand business goals and drivers and translate those into appropriate analytics solutions
job_req: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field 3+ years of experience in BI engineering Retail Experience is a plus Strong understanding of Tableau Architecture required to perform effectively (Tableau Certified is preferred) Understanding and Experience in using Level of Detail, Set Actions, Context Filters, order of operations (aka query pipeline) in Tableau Good Visualisation Skills, Ability to present insights in a Story Proficient in SQL - Knowledge of databases like Amazon Redshift, snowflake etc. and performance tuning techniques. Knowledge of data warehousing and data modeling Strong analytical problem-solving ability Self-starter with the ability to work independently or as part of a project team Ability to understand customer needs and drive impactful business outcomes

Organizational and presentation skills

job_desc: PURPOSE OF JOB  Perform Factory Variance Report analysis, co-ordinate and analyze production variances to submit reports and variance commentary. Responsible for the preparation of absorption analysis on a weekly basis and labor analysis on a monthly basis. Perform monthly closing activities, materials usage variances and reconciliations on inventory under the inventory management initiatives. Assist in costing functions in maintaining standard costs, Standard cost budgeting and ad-hoc requests. Setting up a system to safekeep and maintain proper records of all the contracts/agreements for the plant to facilitate easy retrieval and reference.    JOB FUNCTION  Assist in the compilation and preparation of reports for monthly corporate reporting package and inventory reporting. Monitor the inventory movements to track the aging for goods return. Prepare inventory and relevant Manufacturing template reports for corporate reporting. Perform monthly closing activities, reconcile and analyze materials usage and alternate parts usage reports, stock delivery report and inventory balances under the VMI programs. Assist in quarterly random cycle count audit on all inventory locations. Prepare audit schedules and liaison with external auditor in the areas of responsibility. Assist in annual standard cost budgeting. Assist in year end standard cost cut-over and cost roll to new fiscal year. Co-ordinate with all to maintain proper to up-top-date record and filing of contracts for the plant. Perform any other tasks as assigned.    INTERACTIONS  Plant Manager, Departmental Manager, IT Business Analyst and Production Supervisors. Senior Cost Accountant, Senior Financial Accountant, Accounts Executive, Costing Executive. Planners & Buyers & Engineers. Internal & External Auditors. US Corporate Finance Team
job_req: ‘O” Levels, plus LCCI Diploma in Accounting, as a minimum 3 years’ experience in manufacturing environment. Highly proficient in financial modeling through use of spreadsheets/databases.

job_desc: About us PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity and open collaboration while having fun doing it. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Hong Kong and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more! Your profile & role on the project YOU:   Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed?   Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now?   Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised?   Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats?    Responsible for the whole of a project, from inception through to completion and will be the team member responsible for the full delivery A hybrid of Project Manager / Business Analyst / Implementer roles that would require a very high level of flexibility to adapt to the different parties involved, from the development team to the tech leads, to the scrum master, POs, business and technology stakeholders Be able to objectively look at the constraints and pain points encountered by both our team and clients in order to steer the project into the right direction. The delivery lead should be able to shield our team in order to create the most optimal environment for them in terms of productivity (quality before quantity) but should also be able to push the team to deliver within the timelines established while still adhering to our Palo way of doing things (values and delivery model) Work hand in hand with the account manager to leverage on their knowledge and relationship with the clients to best handle the delivery objectives (on time, on budget). Work hand in hand with our business development team to ensure our clients have a deep understanding of our delivery model and that our approach is well explained / detailed in our proposals / project team structure Touch base on a regular basis with the different hive masters / tech leads at Palo to keep the deliver model / engine up to date with the best practices specific to each stream Help the different hives to adopt our delivery model by establishing the awareness and helping out with the training plans
job_req: Have a good understanding of Scrum - understand all the ceremonies, the different roles so as to be support the client and team in their constant inspection and adaptation cycles Have a good understanding of DevOps / QA / Test Automation fundamentals Have a good understanding of the development best practices Have a good understanding of the challenges a Digital / Agile transformation would mean for our clients and be able to assess at a high level their maturity

job_desc: Allegis Global Solutions is the exclusive Contingent HR services provider for one of the world’s leading banks. At Allegis Global Solutions we’re proud to be the leader in global talent solutions. We draw upon decades of industry expertise to develop innovative tools, products, processes and strategies focused on outcome. Moreover, we’re incredibly proud to have built a culture that empowers our people to make their mark while making deep connections that will last a lifetime. With our passion and culture for talent, we are truly transforming the way the World acquires talent. Our Client is one of the world's most international banks with over 1,100 branches, offices and outlets in 67 countries. They operate in some of the world's most dynamic markets and have been for over 150 years. More than 90 per cent of their income and profits are derived from Asia, Africa and the Middle East. Their brand promise, Here for good, underlines their distinctive approach.
job_req: As a Business Analyst  within Financial Markets Regulatory programme, you will be involved in critical regulatory projects, working in a dynamic global team with software engineers, other project managers, business stakeholders, Operational partners and other technical experts globally.  Perform in-depth analysis around key requirements of the project and regulatory changes (Trade Reporting Regulatory projects). Working with technology teams to design the reconciliation solution and process, implement the reconciliation tool into the bank’s architecture. Defining and establishing the necessary source TP feeds into the reconciliation tool. Defining and establishing the necessary source Trade Repository feeds into the reconciliation tool Operationalizing the analysis and categorization of breaks (second half of year) Articulate the Scope / requirements in standard documents/process flow diagrams/use case diagrams etc to secure signoff from stakeholders. Participation in industry forums / calls and interpretation of new regulations or changes to existing regulations. Conduct meetings and relevant discussions to engage stakeholders in the right perspective and take the task to closure. Manage relationships with key stakeholders both internal (Legal, Compliance, other tech teams, Transaction Reporting teams) and external (DTCC, Industry calls, Regulators etc). Identify risks & issues and communicate them to the relevant people in a timely manner – assist with proposing & planning mitigating steps. Determine Strategic Solutions / Proposals – focusing on long term efficiency, risk reduction and regulatory compliance Maintain a culture of risk awareness and proactive resolution. Facilitates Business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications Co-ordinate and manage the delivery of the project across FMO, IT and relevant FO teams Provide solutions as well as produce a clear cut functional specifications for development team. Use appropriate tools like JIRA, WIKI etc to ensure that Functional Specifications are split and managed with development team in terms of clarity and implementation. Pro-actively engage, manage & build relationships with both technology (including vendors) & business stakeholders. Assist the PM with planning of BA tasks.  Requirements  Good  experience of managing change – both project leadership and business analysis skills Experience of OTC products & trade lifecycle aligned to industry best practice Ability to document functional solution designs of high quality with no ambiguity. Articulate requirements clearly by using graphic and workflow tools like Visio, wireframe tools etc. Ability to work proactively & independently and display initiative Pragmatic team player with an attention to detail Excellent communication and organizational skills with ability to work effectively cross department and geography Proactive and driven individual – independent thinker able to influence and motivate others. Confidence to challenge the status quo & provide alternative solutions Strong problem solving and analytical skills Multicultural awareness Experience of Dodd Frank and/or EMIR regulations is desirable Experience of agile analysis & development

job_desc: Position Responsibilities:   Singapore GBDS Location manager will report to Regional GBDS manager.  The role will be responsible for GBDS operations to include mail services, Smart Print, Record management, employee transportation and Print Production services in Singapore. The role will also be the primary contact for the implementation of new initiatives for all the services and provide analytical focus to all GBDS functions in the location.  This role will work in partnership with Regional Mail & Printing leads and Regional GBDS Business Manager to ensure global strategies, processes and procedures are implemented where appropriate.  They will develop and implement strategies domestically and ensure all standard operating procedures and corporate policies are in place for these functions.    • Primary contact for implementation of operational objectives, programs, policies and initiatives, liaising and coordinating with Regional Print and Mail and Location Managers to ensure successful roll out. • Stake holder management • Implement and administer enterprise-wide document management systems and related procedures that allow firm to capture, store, retrieve, share, and destroy electronic records and documents. • Primary contact for Audit & Compliance to ensure controls are in place for these functions. • Responsible for managing JPMC Corporate club memberships • Point of contact and vendor manager of Ground Transportation vendor and company used corporate vehicles. • Review current operating procedures and identify inefficiencies and then develops initiatives and solutions • Coordinates training and education sessions for these functions. • Financial Analysis • Risk & Controls • Policy & Compliance, and • Business Information Reporting.   Scope:   GBDS Products Lead • Lead the role out of Mail & Messenger application tools such as Pac Track, SmartTrack, DHL invoice Billing System. • Lead the role out of SmartPrint tools, manage the location invoicing for both print and mail vendors. • Work with regional teams to implement standard process and procedures. • Responsible for identifying special projects and training opportunities and coordinating training sessions. • Maintain project tracking / open deliverable reporting • Analyze Print, Mail & Messenger vendor reporting, identifying areas of opportunities, both internal and external. • Introduce best practices, implement initiatives for centralization and automation of Mail & Print functions where possible. • Look at strategies around Print, Transport, Mail & Messenger vendors, and be the key contract person to work with sourcing of suppliers for this function. • Drive and implement the full end to end process of printing services in Singapore where demand has been identified. • Implement digital mail solution.   Records digitization • Drive digitization across various LOBs • Understand the data capture technology to import digitized documents into document management system. • Implement scanning or other automated data entry procedures, using imaging devices and document imaging software. • Conduct needs assessments to identify document management requirements of departments or end users • Assist in the development of document or content classification taxonomies to facilitate information capture, search, and retrieval. • Assist in determining document management policies to facilitate efficient, legal, and secure access to electronic content. • Monitor regulatory activity to maintain compliance with records and document management laws. • Contributing to the development and maintenance of the document management policy and document management systems; • Assisting in elaborating the implementing rules and procedures concerning registration, filing, archiving and retention of documents and files, taking into account relevant provisions concerning information security and protection of personal data; • Assisting with managing the various electronic document management systems • Working together with staff from other teams to ensure the information of the client is managed in a secure way; • Performing any other duties as required by line management in the interest of the Service   Business Analyst • Financial Planning & Analysis: o Work closely with the APAC GBDS Business Manager to provide timely GBDS financial reporting; o Be the point of contact for the APAC GBDS Business Manager in terms of reporting and analyzing Singapore GBDS results; o Maintain tracking of Plan numbers and report all variances and associated actions required. • Risk & Controls: o To ensure that appropriate controls are observed and business process and policies are adhered to by Singapore GBDS; o Work with APAC GBDS Business Manager to ensure Control Self-Assessments (CSAs) and business resiliency documentation is up to date; o Oversee all Outsider Service Provider (OSP) reviews relating to Singapore GBDS activities. • Policy & Compliance: o Ensure that the  Regional GBDS policies are adhered to via assessments, physical checks or random sampling; o Work closely with the APAC GBDS Business Manager and Audit group to ensure compliance with any internal reviews. • Business Information Reporting: o Have input into the development of Business Information for GBDS and Lines of Business o Provide support around Data mining, analysis and reporting relevant to both GBDS internal functions as well as Line of Business requirements; o Liaise with Line of Business finance teams to provide appropriate information concerning GBDS charges.

job_desc: Business Process Re-Engineering Associate Job Description:-  The Process Reengineering Associate will work closely with Process Reengineering leadership and will be responsible for understanding and documenting the current business process; identify improvement areas/opportunities to drive in operational efficiencies; The incumbent  will be required to interact with the business/process/services/IT  stakeholders and related line managers to identify process gaps and recommend improvements using Design Thinking, Lean and Value Stream Mapping Frameworks. He/she need to effectively work through complexities associated with coordination across multiple entities, conflicting efforts, and limited resources. Manages multiple operational, financial, and compliance projects and support project team to achieve the scope, timing and objectives of each complex assignment. Utilize strong analytics, technical and communication skills as well as deep, broad understanding of the business to summarize key findings. Must have minimum 3 years or more experience with transformation, business process analysis, process re-engineering, statistical process controls, cost reduction techniques, and lean Six Sigma techniques Work Location: Based out of Singapore but may involve some travel  Key Responsibilities:   Process Improvements/Technical skills  Strong qualitative and quantitative analytical ability to draw sound conclusions and make appropriate recommendations to management Understand and document the current working process in details (review, document and assess critical business processes) Uses end-to-end mapping and analysis to identify opportunities for improvement that positively impact up-stream and down-stream business partners. Provides technical expertise for the planning, managing and implementation of enterprise-wide process improvement initiatives. Perform data manipulation and analysis (graphical and statistical) as required in support of performance metric reporting. Facilitating process workshops that involve eliciting process requirements and liaising with users to identify gaps and recommend improvements to deliver the artefacts, backlog of functions, coaching the Product Owner and Consulting during execution of Target-Operating-Model of Processes Develop metrics that provide data for process measurement, identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities Support project in validating the user requirements via testing    Project Support  Support multiple project backlogs which may have many internal and external dependencies, are complex in scope, have divisional and/or organization-wide impact, have multiple integration points, a higher level or risk requiring mitigation plans and are worked within multiple teams of resources. Develop reports, monitoring and evaluation activities of current projects and/or actions targeted to improve key metrics and customer insights. Responsible for design, development, implementation, and integration of people, processes, and technology needed for successful implementation of initiatives. Identify, communicate, and report significant deviations from project plan/quality    Relationship Management  Provides insight from a business perspective on the direction and continued utilization of continuous improvement methodologies. Works with all levels (leaders, managers, and associates) of assigned areas to identify opportunities for improvement, structure efforts to achieve the targeted improvements and establish measurement systems to monitor performance.
job_req: Mandatory Requirements  3 or more years of experience in the insurance industry (GI and or Life and Health) 2 or more years of experience in continuous improvement initiatives and complex projects and Process transformation using Design Thinking, Lean or Value Stream Mapping Workshops to create a transformative Target Operating Model-Processes Experience of working closely with Business and IT Leaders  Solid experience within at least two or more functional area (policy administration, claims, customer services and Underwriting) Experience in Continuous Improvement of the Processes using the CI Frameworks, Service Design Sprints, Kanban ways of delivering solution for Services Management Highly collaborative with a demonstrated ability to build strong, credible relationships and teams within all levels in the organization Good Communication skills High critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy  Added Advantage:  Familiarity with project management tools (Jira, confluence, MPP) Understand the ways ERP, BPM, CRM, RPA and Salesforce work and context of Process Re-Engineering Lean/Six Sigma certification Green Belt/Black Belt Project Management / Change Management certifications (e.g. PMP) Knowledge of Business Process Management

job_desc: AvePoint is the Microsoft Cloud expert. Over 15,000 companies and 6 million cloud users worldwide trust AvePoint to migrate, manage, and protect their Office 365 and SharePoint data. AvePoint’s integrated cloud, hybrid, and on-premises software solutions are enhanced by 24/7 support and award-winning services. Organizations across six continents and all industries rely on AvePoint to ease transition to the Microsoft Cloud, increase IT administrator productivity, and satisfy governance and compliance objectives.  AvePoint is seeking a Business Analyst with enterprise software solutions experience to join us in our Client Services division. The Business Analyst analyzes business processes and applicable automated systems, and develops As-Is and To-Be descriptions. This individual leads requirements gathering and analysis activities, prepares and delivers written and oral communications, participates in testing activities, helps design methods and procedures for internal and external projects. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Elicit requirements for software development using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analyses. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into detail, identify risks, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Translate technical information into business language to ensure understanding of the requirements by both technical and non-technical audiences. Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, GUI, Screen and Interface designs. Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. Operate as the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams. Support the project manager and other team members in planning deliverables, scope, schedule, and other aspects of the project Supervise at least two junior team members, including conducting interviews, making hiring recommendations, conducting regular 1-on-1 meetings, drafting IDPs, and completing performance evaluations.
job_req: 3 years SharePoint experience at least; product manager experience SharePoint maintenance experience; SharePoint portal project experience; computing or software relevant bachelor degree Understanding of Microsoft SharePoint architecture, components, and configuration Understands Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures Professional experience with analyzing and documenting complex business processes, software development requirements, and taxonomies. Professional experience with requirements gathering and analysis. Experience producing and analyzing As-Is and To-Be documentation. Experience preparing and delivering written and oral communications. Strong analytical and project management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Familiarity with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint). Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Experience supervising junior associates, including conducting interviews, making hire recommendations, and completing performance reviews.

job_desc: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.   To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit.  It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities  - Document Business requirements for the specific functionalities  - Ability to comprehend the phased delivery approach and work on specific goals at a certain point of time  - Work closely with Senior business stakeholders to gather requirements and understand the process and solution to be delivered  - Experience with working closely with developers and testers  - Responsible for the delivery from front to end  - Be a team player and able to deal with stakeholders and teams spread across multiple geographical locations  - Strong Communication skills are required
job_req: Our Ideal Candidate Key Skills Required  - Strong experience working with Murex, in excess of 7 years+  - Strong experience in Physical & Financial Commodities including Energy, Precious Metals and AGS  - Past experience with OTC derivatives / physical transactions for Commodities including a clear understanding of logistics  - Strong Experience with Custodian and clearing model for Commodities, previous experience working with ICE, CME etc  - Experience ideally with the front to back flow within the Commodities business Qualifications & Skills  - Worked as a BA for at least 10-12 years,  with at least 5 years + in Commodities  - Excellent written and verbal English. Including good soft skills  - Previously worked on Big multiyear projects with phased deliveries  - Strong Analytical skills, experience in managing senior stakeholders.  - Past experience with working for a bank, preferred  - Experience in working in a regulated framework  - Ability to multi task and work on more than one item at a time  - Past experience of working in an agile environment  - Ability to work individually or as part of a team  How to Apply Please visit - https://scb.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobdetail.ftl?job=1900009529&lang=en  to apply now and take the next step in fulfilling your potential. You can search and view current opportunities across our global organisation and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com.  To help speed up your application, please note the following: •    You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role •    Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information) •    We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience. Diversity & Inclusion  Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximise their personal potential.

job_desc: Responsibilities Project Delivery  Provide technical leadership in complex project(s) independently. Define system-level application architecture that includes high-level design, architectural policies and principles, design and programming guidelines, implementation risks and mitigation measures, software development and integration strategies, software configuration controls, etc. Maintain control over the architecture throughout the entire software development lifecycle by continuously making critical adjustments to the architecture to ensure desired results are achieved. Involve in requirement analysis phase to ensure the implementation feasibility of functional specifications. Highlight requirement gaps, disproportional construction efforts, technical challenges and any other issues to business analyst teams. Develop the Technical Design Specification (TDS) independently. Provide technical leadership in the project through established design and development methodologies, to ensure system meets functional and system requirements. Engage customers to explain the rationale of architecture’s selection, or other technical issues. Ensure best practices, frameworks and re-useable components are employed in the project. Trouble-shoot technical problems faced by the project team.    Organisation Development  Coach, train and mentor Associate Architects and Architects. Share technology knowledge with the rest of organisation through Community of Practice (CoPs) or other in-house forums. Package and conduct in-depth technical courses. Contribute to knowledge repository on experience learnt through project implementation.  Business Development  Be involved in pre-sales solution activities to review technical solution and estimated effort prepared by proposal team. Help NCS to win mindshare to be speaker or panellist in IT-related trade show or seminar.
job_req: Typically 8 years’ experience in technical role with responsibilities that apply in-depth knowledge of architectural principles and design. Experience in developing and deploying complex scalable production applications on Cloud/PaaS platforms and Containers.

job_desc: BAMBU is a FinTech startup, who specializes in providing Robo-Advisory solutions for banks, insurance companies to non-financial industries like Telcos & Ecommerce. Leveraging on machine learning, we believe we can change the way people save, invest and manage their wealth. We have been rapidly expanding and in a short span of two years, have clinched 10 clients across ASEAN, EMEA, and US. We were chosen as the best startup for Fintech final 2017 as well as Fintech of the Year by The Asset Awards 2017. Here at BAMBU, we believe wealth management should be made easily accessible, through delivering great products that provide beautiful user journeys and experiences. We don’t just want to make it simpler, we want to redefine the entire way wealth services are delivered. We are looking for a Business Analyst who shares the same passion with us. You will be at forefront of the implementation of our technology, communication with our clients and ensuring our cutting-edge products are being delivered. You should be a multidisciplinary person who can speak both tech and business language. Key Responsibilities:  Work closely with our development team to determine the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners. Implement advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing data requirements Convert client requirements into business logic  Conduct various requirements workshop to ensure smooth delivery Working with stakeholders at all levels as defined by the individuals project Assisting with integration and acceptance testing Providing support during and post implementation Ensure smooth communication with our client by acting as a ‘translator’ between business and IT Testing of APIs from external software providers
job_req: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – written and verbal  Experience working directly with customers   Experience working in a startup environment Experience with agile software delivery Experience with software-as-a-service and API-based business models   Understanding of microservice architecture Banking Experience in Wealth Management/ Group Technology and Operations preferred  Javascript or Python experience preferred

job_desc: Key Responsibilities In this role, the Business Analyst will be required to: • Completing Feasibility study and/or gapping analysis to determine the CFO system architecture to be deployed for the specific requirements of the infrastructure initiative (Recommended CFO system/process architecture) • Determining the CFO requirements and the solution requirements through systems set up, configuration and development  (Deliverables include; Business requirement document) • Gather detailed data and functional requirements to support CFO processes, document in clear, concise and comprehensive manner, and articulate to IT teams for their understanding • Conduct working group meeting, business requirement gathering workshops and UAT status update meetings with CFO users and IT teams • Execute against the test plans and co-ordinate the execution of user acceptance testing by CFO user groups involved (Deliverables include; Test plan, Test cases with expected results, Defect register and resolution plan) • Determining and co-ordinating the execution of system deployment in a production environment • Provide prompt and concise status updates to project managers, including accurate progress updates and escalation of risks, issues and dependencies in respective areas of responsibilities
