job_desc: You will be the Business Analyst (BA) specialising in the digital channels (internet/mobile banking) platform within the Private Banking space. The main role of the business analyst is to analyse, propose best business practices/design options, finalise best solution with business and map the business requirements into clear technical specifications. This will involve working with the business and technology stakeholders to clarify requirements, analyse and propose options and decide on the best solution. Working with various technical teams within the bank to identify functional changes in the systems, preparing the functional specifications and also walkthrough the functional specifications with the business to obtain sign-off. The BA is also expected to verify the final solution to ensure the deliverable is fit-for-purpose. To this end, he/she must fully support development and testing efforts in terms of functional clarifications and ensure that test scenarios are valid and comprehensive. As you will be representing the PB development team in many fronts, you are expected to establish and maintain good working relationships with all that you are engaged with.           SME and Custodian for one or more functional knowledge areas within the platform        Analyse/clarify the business requirements        Conduct in-depth impact analysis on the application        Propose best business practices and design        Work with the vendor teams to come up with the functional specification document (FSD)        Conduct FSD workshops to walkthrough the functionality to obtain user sign-off        Align with solutioning/dev teams on technical feasibility studies        Analyse the technical specifications and provide the TSD        Conduct TSD workshops to walkthrough the technical solution        Conduct walkthrough for testers to clarify new functionalities        Validate test coverage and test cases created by the testing team        Maintain traceability between BRD, FSD, TSD and Test Cases        Support testing as functional SME
job_req: Bachelor’s degree in computer science/engineering/information systems Deep experience in the digital platform space, internet and mobile banking Good private banking domain knowledge, such as Portfolio Management, Products and Trade Flow Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment to meet tight project timelines Strong communicator that can drive consensus Knowledge in digital banking technologies Temenos Triple A Plus product knowledge Technical skills to support analysis work, eg able to read and understand business logic scripts/code, understand system entity/data model, execute SQL queries for data extraction

job_desc: Company Overview Intellect Minds is a Singapore-based company since 2008, specializing in talent acquisition, application development, and training. We serve BIG MNCs and well-known clients in talent acquisition, application development, and training needs for Singapore, Malaysia, Brunei, Vietnam and Thailand. Our client is an establish company a, leader within their industry, is now looking for a Content Delivery Lead (Business Analyst / UX Lead) to join their esteemed organization.   Roles and Responsibilities  • Work with business users and stakeholders to develop a deep understanding of their needs, processes, goals, and priorities. • Document business processes and assist with process improvements. • Gather and maintain business requirements with appropriate documentation (for example, a story backlog and acceptance criteria for an agile project). • Act as a liaison for business customers in technology projects. • Evaluate and recommend solutions for business needs. • Design user experience solutions for multiple products on various platforms. • Participate in developing the research and user experience plans for each project. • Apply user-centered design principles to help create these product experiences. • Act as a user advocate, leveraging user research methodologies and techniques to identify insights about users and how to build products that meet their needs. • Quickly and iteratively create artifacts that illuminate user tasks, define proposed product functionality, turn business requirements into conceptualizations of the proposed product, and effectively communicate the overall user experience to the project team and our business partners. These artifacts may include: • Competitive product analyses, Personas, Task/process flows, screen flows, storyboards, usage scenarios, detailed descriptions of proposed interactions/behaviors, usage models • Information architectures, site maps, navigation maps, page flows, sketches, conceptual design mockups, wireframes, prototypes, interaction design idioms and other user experience design deliverables as needed. • Gather and track feedback and key design decisions generated from continuous review of these artifacts to iteratively improve the user experience. • Conduct usability evaluations using paper or semi-functional prototypes or existing applications. • Facilitate Design Studios with other designers and members of the development team. • Work closely and efficiently with a cross-functional and interdisciplinary team that includes other analysts, designers, UI developers, architects, and distributed development teams. • Lead backlog-grooming sessions to explain the business requirements to development teams and collaborate on refinements and clarifications. • Recognize project risks and make recommendations to the Service Delivery Manager that balance tradeoffs, scope creep, iterative design, and phased releases. • Develop expert-level knowledge of competitive and complementary products for the purpose of bringing new ideas to each project.
job_req: Skills/Abilities: • Excellent communication skills for discussions, presentations, and documentation. Examples of slide decks and documentation are welcome. • Exceptional interviewing, probing, and influencing skills • Creative and innovative thinker • Self-motivated and able to work independently and in a team environment • Process modeling, preferably using BPMN • Experience in digital asset management preferred All successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits. Interested Candidates please submit your detailed resume online. To your success! The Recruitment Team Intellect Minds Pte Ltd (Singapore)

job_desc: Job Title: Business Analyst – SAP with training provided Job Description: Candidate will experience in project implementation and be able to work in a team with experienced project implementation consultants to complete ABeam projects locally or overseas. Training Programme: This Company Led Training (CLT) programme is a 6-months on the job training with ABeam Consulting (Singapore) to equip mid-level professionals with industry skills to become SAP Functional Consultant. Each trainee/apprentice will be trained and mentored in areas such as:  Basis Hi-Tech Business Process Overview SAP FICO, SAP SD and SAP MM Overview and workshop SAP Leonardo Introduction Consultation skills i.e Logical thinking, documentation, interview process  Job Description:  The trainee program includes: - 6 months’ duration, which divided into class room training and OJT.  The selected trainee will gain opportunity to be trained in Japan.  Opportunities to participate in workshops, trainings to acquire new skills (soft skills, software based skills, etc.), and participate in the IT implementation project.
job_req: Mid-level professionals, must have a completed bachelor degree in any disciplines, preferably major topics in IT or Finance and Accounting Confident in communicating and presenting in front of crowd or a small group of people   Able to write clearly and concisely in prepare writing materials   Analytical and problem solving skills Ability to work efficiently under pressure Able to work independently, as well as a team player Certificate of Japanese Language Proficiency Level N3 is required for trainee who keen to participate OJT which will be held in Tokyo, Japan. Singapore citizens only  Take this opportunity to join an international team of professionals, implement and develop software and consulting solutions in international projects and gain cultural experience, to set a serious foundation for future career steps.

job_desc: Business Function  Group Legal, Compliance & Secretariat ensures that the bank's interests are protected by zealously guarding and enhancing its reputation and capital. We also work to maintain a good standing with all our regulators, customers, and business partners. Because we believe that at the heart of business banking is to uphold the values of trust and integrity for all our stakeholders. Responsibilities This role is required to support Enterprise KYC (Know Your Customer)/CDD (Customer Due Diligence) and Screening Journey as one of the programs within LCS Strategic Transformation Programmes. The job scope is as follows:  Consult with business users and SMEs to identify challenges and enhancements to improve CDD and Screening business processes and to mitigate/reduce risks. Collaborate with cross-functional team members (business, platform, analytics, financial crime advisory, transformation, etc) to assess KYC/CDD and Screening policies/standards, business processes, systems, data and identify opportunities to increase efficiencies, effectiveness, and reduce operational risks. Synthesise and accurately document key pieces of information gathered in easily understandable format. Contribute and solicit information from various stakeholders to understand and define detailed requirement specifications/user stories. Manage small initiatives within Enterprise KYC/CDD and Screening program as required. Coordinate user acceptance tests, dress rehearsals and cut-over activities by working closely with technology partners and business users. Lead post-implementation stabilisation activities, if required. Prepare status reports to program manager and stakeholders. Assist in any other relevant tasks critical to successful program execution.
job_req: Bachelor Degree in any related field. Minimum 7 years’ of working experience in AML/KYC/CDD, Name or Payment/Transaction Screening processes and good understanding of the concepts. Experience in business analysis and/or root cause analysis, ideally in the Financial Services industry or in a Compliance or audit function related to AML or KYC/CDD.   Basic knowledge of MAS 626 or equivalent AML/CFT regulations and industry practices. Industry certification in AML/CFT (CAMS, ICA, etc) is preferred but is not mandatory. Good skills in Microsoft Office (Power Point) and project management tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence, Octane). Excellent communication and organizational skills and can be relied upon to make quick, accurate and precise decisions. Good Relationship-building, conflict resolution and analytical/problem-solving skills. Ability to multi-task with some planning skills to effectively manage changing priorities. Ability to interface on a professional level at all times with a variety of different personalities at different levels. Self-motivated and Excellent Team player.

job_desc: Business Function  Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.   About the role   This role requires an experienced business analyst, with knowledge of end to end credit life cycle management from credit origination to credit measurement/monitoring, to actively execute and monitor project related activities and constantly deliver quality project deliverables. The candidate shall be required to quickly understand the current operating model and define the target state operating model.  Working as part of a regional team within our Singapore office although some overseas travel will be required.   Responsibilities   On a day to day basis provide support to the project team lead within the program. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring coordination of project activities and delivering of project deliverables. The candidates may be required to work across various projects within the program. The candidate should have an understanding of a wide range of banking book products with an appreciation of counterparty credit processes.    Gather and document business and technology requirements; data analysis. Define business processes & data flows. Work with system architects to define appropriate technology solutions.  Document the necessary functional specifications for system development. Work closely with UX designer on clarifying requirements throughout the project life cycle. Act as an interface between development teams and business end users. Liaise with system developers through the system development life cycle to ensure common understanding. Assist in day to day project activities to ensure document, activities are monitored and completed on time. Support project managers to provide weekly status updates and track project schedule. Lead project streams and manage project finances when required. Manage change in requirements based on defined process Plan, Participate and Coordinate test phases prior to implementation. Develop test plans against the functional specification. Execute functional testing of the new solution. Support various stages of testing, including UAT in preparation for production go-live. Assist preparation of training materials and user guide; conduct necessary training to users. Assist product owner in the development of user guides/manuals. Assist in preparation of project review and closure documents.
job_req: This is a hands-on role requiring a strong business analyst to engage in a fast moving and large scale credit architecture development program.  Good understanding of banking domain (specific domain: credit process), banking book (Lending, Trade Finance and CASA) products with credit risk management. Experience in capturing business and technology requirements, systems development life cycle, writing functional specifications, writing test scripts and executing functional tests, analysis of credit risk system requirements. Experience of working with relationship managers, credit risk managers and technical specialists; and understand credit risk end-to-end management and operating model. Proven track record of participating in the delivery of credit risk technology solutions. Either vendor systems or preferably an in-house solution. Ability to plan and conduct interviews with business end users on complex topics. A motivated self-starter with ability to multitask but requires minimal supervision to meet challenging targets, embody a `whatever it takes to get the job done` attitude. Able to operate independently and make sound decisions, but a team player with collaborative attitude and enjoys working in teams. Effective problem solving and analytical skills with attention to detail while maintaining a big picture outlook. Maintain high productivity in a fast paced environment showing effective prioritization skills. Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Proficient in MS Office and able to produce board-level documentation. Proficiency in some form of programming and database technology, such as Java, Oracle/Mysql/Mongodb etc… Strong facilitation skills and experience facilitating workshops with large groups. Experience in various requirements models like use case models, business process models, data flow diagrams, context diagrams and sequence diagrams etc… Experience in working with agile software development methodologies. Some skills in usage of any issue/problem tracking, defect management tool and MS SharePoint is required. Experience in working with multi location teams will be an added advantage.

job_desc: It is an exciting time at ADA, we are expanding globally and creating a broad new range of products in some of today’s most exciting technology sectors. Do you have the speed and creativity, start-up mentality and love the idea of managing the product development of Developer Platform from start? Do you want to be responsible for the long-tail strategy, which includes working on programs and campaigns across ASEAN for startups, developers, SMEs? If you are applying for this role, you are an experienced in leading international teams across ASEAN who is able to take a standalone, hands on approach to build the Company’s Developer platform. You will hire the right team that will be the center piece for creating universal and central system for internal use and for customer usage. With your newly formed team, you will be solving complex business problems for our customers, by combining advanced data analytics with proprietary, built in-house technology to help us generate demand and attract potential customers while retaining existing customers with incredible efficiency and value-add. You will be a bold thinker, agile and standout innovator who motivates others to explore new frontiers by pushing the boundaries of technology. You can expect to be given ambitious but achievable business goals, but show quick results by building in short iterations with lots of experimentation. The Job holder duties and responsibilities shall include: -  Lead the creation of the Developer platform and long-tail strategy.  Hire a team of Business Analyst, Digital Marketing Manager, Event Manager, Business Support, Technical support, Tech Evangelists, Business Development Managers across Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand. Setup the KPIs for each team member, and create processes to track the progress Synthesize requirements from internal and external (customers, prospects, developers, CIOs, students) stakeholders to build the roadmap and implementation of the analytics program to meet the internal product performance analytics requirements as well as to align with requirements from Data as a service solution offering. Research the market and competitive landscape from a strategic business and go-to-market perspective as well as to inspire innovative and collaborative initiatives. Create cross functional team from internal and external resources to deliver on the analytics program. Put in place the data governance structure around Developer platform. Lead the vision, design, implementation and delivery of Developer platform that supports large scale data processing in batch mode as well as real-time Cluster large amount of user generated content and process data in large-scale environments using tools such as Big Data architecture on Google, Amazon EC2, Storm, Hadoop and Spark Integrate diverse data sources into solutions Research new modelling techniques and other innovations as appropriate for a specific solution Building and owning production models, pipelines, and runtimes Put in place drag and drop dashboard for internal business users – product managers, marketing, sales, finance, operations etc as well as external partners. Create go-to-market strategies across ASEAN
job_req: QUALIFICATIONS  Masters or PhD degree in engineering or business is preferred. Expertise in Product and Project management. Expert in data analytics and team leadership. Expert in cloud technologies, preferably AWS and agile methodologies Experience in running a tech startup Experience in sales or marketing roles in tech companies, focusing on cloud or platform technologies  EXPERIENCE  5+ years of experience as a team lead 3+ year in sales or marketing roles 2+ year as product manager Experience in product management of tech platforms or SaaS, PaaS Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy.  ATTRIBUTES  You are always looking for opportunities to test new machine learning tools and frameworks. Great communicator in writing and verbal You enjoy taking products that delight their users and making them better. You are obsessed with software quality, consistency, maintainability, scalability, performance, security and all the other things that make great software great. You are obsessed with user experience. You pay excruciating attention to detail but couple that with an ability to think abstractly. You are an advocate of true agile development methodology Excellent people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties. Team player! Must be a strong public speaker, comfortable in front of large, senior groups, and a solid writer. Exceptional ROI-tracking skills, able to prove what is –or isn’t—working This role reports to the CEO of the Company.

job_desc: INSEAD brings together people, cultures and ideas to develop responsible leaders who transform business and society.  As a mission-driven school, INSEAD focuses on three values: open, rigorous, and entrepreneurial. Founded on a commitment to innovation in management education, INSEAD was the first international business school, introduced the first one-year MBA, pioneered company specific executive education, and has developed a unique fully integrated multi-continent campus structure. Today, no more than 10% of the incoming MBA class comes from one country – we truly are the Business School for the World. We are excited to launch a new position of Transformation Programme Analyst to join our Transformation Office on a 18month/2 year contract role, full time basis. Reporting to the Chief Transformation Officer (CTO), the ideal candidate will provide analytic support to INSEAD’s transformation office under the direction of INSEAD’s Dean and CTO. The work in this role will mean working with global teams, as the transformation is being driven across all of INSEAD’s campuses and includes all functions/departments at the school. Key Responsibilities include:  Supporting the Chief Transformation Officer and the Momentum Transformation Programme Director in the running of the Momentum Programme Conducting data analysis to drive operational and strategic decision making Building PowerPoint slide decks to present challenges, opportunities and recommendations and to report on programme progress for workstream leaders, programme Steering Committee and INSEAD’s Executive Committee Building of business cases for efficiency and effectiveness initiatives Process mapping and process simplification analysis and recommendations Conducting research and generating benchmarks Collaborating with the Momentum programme controller to establish benefits targets, to track progress and to establish performance indicators at the initiative level Assisting the Transformation Programme Manager in the overall project management of the Momentum programme

job_desc: Procurement Technologies Specialist / Business Analyst Who we are Telenor Group is one of the world’s major mobile operators. We keep our customers connected in 8 markets across Europe and Asia. More than 20,000 employees are committed to responsible business conduct and being our customers’ favourite partner in digital life. Connecting the world has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years, and we are driven by a singular vision: to empower societies. Telenor Group has 175 million mobile subscriptions and revenues of SGD 18 billion in 2017.   Telenor Procurement Company (TPC), established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group.  TPC delivers Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full accountability for the end-to-end sourcing process and performance of global spend categories.   What will you do As a Business Analyst you will be a part of the Procurement Operations Team and report directly to the Head of Procurement Technologies as part of the Operations Department. We are rolling out a global procure-to-pay Software-as-a-service solution in 8 countries and you will be deeply engaged in conducting this roll out on a technical and functional aspect.   The Strategy team is responsible for organizing the annual strategy process for Telenor Sweden and for facilitating development of concrete action plans to ensure execution of our strategy in close cooperation with each division. In addition, working structurally with our M&A agenda, ensuring focus on and progress of key structural improvement initiatives as well as leading selected strategic projects are parts of the team’s responsibilities. As such, you will be working alongside key stakeholders within Telenor Sweden and Telenor Group, giving you a broad exposure and in-depth understanding of all of our business areas. This position is a perfect entry point to take on high business impact and leadership positions in the future.   You will:  Communicate with stakeholders in various countries and from various backgrounds (Finance, HR, Sourcing, IT…) to understand their current processes and needs Design solutions to align global processes with local processes, vice versa. Coordinate with a technical team based in Norway and Pakistan Help in reporting accurately to the project and program team Analyse business data and extract/explain KPIs in a comprehensive way Enjoy working with highly skilled people in a diverse and respectful environment Be part of a multicultural/international team      Our promise  A balanced workforce is key to our success. To secure that, we’re committed to fostering a working environment where our employees are supported and empowered in all areas of their work. We promise you a company eager to learn and rapidly adapt to a digital world where you will be welcomed into a skilled team of professional and knowledgeable colleagues. In addition, you will get: A flexible way of work - have a lunch workout without having to rush back, be able to leave/pick up the kids from school, work from home when you need to? This is no problem if you make sure your team is happy and you perform and deliver your work A generous health and benefit package Development programs to deepen your knowledge and broaden the competence   Who you are: You are a naturally curious person with the ability to learn quickly. You possess sound judgment and excellent analytical- and problem solving skills. Collaborating cross functions and interacting independently with senior management and other key stakeholders is nothing you shy away from. Your communication skills, written and orally, are a testament to your ability to influence others and impact decision-making. You have a sharp strategic mind-set and a structured approach – leading projects and facilitating discussions comes natural to you. Experience working in the telecom industry is a positive advantage, but not mandatory.    2-3 years of relevant work experience, preferably within consulting or strategy related roles Have strong communication skills, both orally and written Have the ability to prioritize tasks and work independently Have the ability to lead projects and facilitate meaningful discussions Experience in Digital Procurement is a huge plus! Experience in Telecom Industry is also a plus.    Good to know Application deadline: 2019-05-10 Start date: 01/07/2019 Location: Singapore, Guocco Tower, Tanjong Pagar Center   Come join us now If you are interested and would like to know more, please contact Vincent Teyssier, vincent.teyssier@telenor.com or +6596269049. Don’t send your CV directly by email – these will not be evaluated.

job_desc: ABOUT TAIGER  Headquartered in Singapore, TAIGER is a fast-growing Artificial Intelligence (AI) company with a global footprint. Our mission is to help organizations optimize operational efficiencies by automating complex cognitive tasks. We are a market leader and the pioneer of Knowledge Work AutomationTM. The solutions we provide use natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision techniques (e.g. semantic analysis, concept-extraction, multi-language knowledge graphs, and object detection) to provide unparalleled accuracy in information extraction for industry leaders across the financial services, government sectors and more. TAIGER is recognized as a Gartner Cool Vendor. Find out more about us at www.taiger.com and www.linkedin.com/company/taiger  BUSINESS ANALYST We are building a team passionate about cutting-edge AI technology and the potential of TAIGER. You should be motivated by growth opportunities with your responsibilities expanding in scope. You can also look forward to be part of a dynamic start-up environment where your contribution matters. RESPONSIBILITIES  Lead and/or participate in the development of functional requirements and technical specifications. Analyse business and user needs, document requirements, and translation into proper system requirement specifications. Provide measurable insights and track timeline of deliverables with insightful analysis to clients or stakeholders. Collaborate with business partners to identify technology needs and ensure business requirements gathering are comprehensive and accurate. Develop and maintain a working knowledge of trends and best practices within TAIGER.
job_req: REQUIREMENTS  At least 2 + years of business analyst experience preferred. Good to have consulting work experience. Strong experience in Agile product development methodologies - various SDLCs, including Waterfall or Agile (SCRUM, Kanban, etc) and/or Test Automation. Superior verbal and written communications skills (particularly in English, but another language is a plus!).  YOU WILL BE AT AN ADVANTAGE WITH THESE SKILLS  Passion for technology, Flexible, hands-on team attitude. Track record of delivering quality, on-time results. Ability to work effectively with clients and engineering staff. MSc, BA/BSc computer science or related discipline, or equivalent experience. Familiarity or interest in AI, Semantic Technologies, NLP and Search Engines.  In TAIGER we believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will result in a better workplace for our team and a better product for our clients. Join the growing team at TAIGER today!   *TAIGER does not engage any recruitment agencies for recruitment of talents into our company. All job applications should be submitted directly to TAIGER.

job_desc: Wealth Management With client assets of around EUR 300 billion (as at September 30, 2017), Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management business is one of the largest asset managers worldwide. We offer affluent clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations. We create lasting value for clients. We develop bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate & Investment Bank and Deutsche Asset Management. We combine financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships. Wealth Management Central Transformation As part of the WM Chief Operating Office structure, Wealth Management Transformation has been established to priorities, drive, and execute the Wealth Management strategic aspirations. This new global transformation function will cover discretionary and mandatory change and has been organized into three keys areas, namely: Central Transformation, Regional and product team and, the Global Change Practices. The WM Transformation function will drive sustainable change and organizational effectiveness through a one team approach, supported by the aggregation of “practice” expertise, regional empowerment and a strong central governance team. The team ensures prioritization of resources and implementation of best practice to ensure successful execution of our agenda to Protect, Transform and grow our business. The Role & Responsibilities  Manage and track change portfolio for WM APAC, working with business sponsors, partners and stakeholders to ensure alignment with business agenda and priorities. Create and administer central framework for change management with clear and agreed processes for delivering projects and change across the entire project lifecycle. Taking ownership for all items assigned, managing the delivery across the full project lifecycle including any interdependencies. Managing the communication and relationship with all the stakeholders and escalation of risk and issues to Program Management / STC as structured Key Responsibilities:  Managing the full delivery of change items within your area of focus. Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis to lead and develop detailed requirements and translate them into functional and non-functional specifications Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details, abstract up low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. All with the goal of providing input to the business and technical specifications are aligned to ensure the requirements are met. Analyze processes, root causes, business impacts, and identify opportunities for improvement. Think outside the box, always consider business need, and be prepared to challenge the stakeholders. Prepare and document clear and concise Project plans / project artifacts and ensure clear business requirements that can easily be tracked and understood. Accountable for the delivery across the full SDLC through to UAT and Business Readiness. Accountable for the process impact to relevant user teams and ensure any process changes are documents and fully understood/agreed by all parties. Managing both the dependencies and the interfaces between projects. Identifying risks and escalation to Program Management / Stakeholders Organize user acceptance testing, support and follow-up investigation of questions, issues, and defects Prepare training and guidance to support the transition to run-the-bank Ensure compliance with policies, standards and regulatory requirement Provide updates to the Business and Project Management on new and on-going projects
job_req: Experience:  Strong interpersonal and communication skills. The ability to find ways of solving or pre-empting problems. Excellent verbal and written English and ability to tailor communication to various audiences. Experience in managing and working with delivery vendors. Proven experience of delivery of change projects within Wealth Management. Working knowledge and experience with Avaloq is a plus. Must be a team player; able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and meet competing/changing deadlines. Proficiency with MS Office Products: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. job_desc: Wealth Management With client assets of around EUR 300 billion (as at September 30, 2017), Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management business is one of the largest asset managers worldwide. We offer affluent clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations. We create lasting value for clients. We develop bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate & Investment Bank and Deutsche Asset Management. We combine financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships. Wealth Management Central Transformation As part of the WM Chief Operating Office structure, Wealth Management Transformation has been established to priorities, drive, and execute the Wealth Management strategic aspirations. This new global transformation function will cover discretionary and mandatory change and has been organized into three keys areas, namely: Central Transformation, Regional and product team and, the Global Change Practices. The WM Transformation function will drive sustainable change and organizational effectiveness through a one team approach, supported by the aggregation of “practice” expertise, regional empowerment and a strong central governance team. The team ensures prioritization of resources and implementation of best practice to ensure successful execution of our agenda to Protect, Transform and grow our business. The ability to find ways of solving or pre-empting problems. Experience in managing and working with delivery vendors. Proven experience of delivery of change projects within Wealth Management. job_req: One of our clients is looking for a Business Process Analyst, who is/are able to fulfill the following requirements:  Requirements: - With 5 Years Experience - Able to problem solve, absorb large amounts of detail and to see the big picture. - Resolve conflicting ideas and demands to provide clarity. - Works with little supervision and able to pick up new or unfamiliar concepts quickly. - Be able to work in a demanding development environment. - See opportunities to standardise practises, build knowledge transfer artefacts and perform knowledge transfer. - Be an excellent standout colleague, with the ability to influence others to achieve success - Domain Knowledge:    -> Authority on Physical and Derivative Deal Life Cycles for Oil or other commodities, including understanding of core concepts such as P&L, Exposure and MTM    -> Understanding of key commercial drivers and how market changes impact us on a wider scale - Systems Knowledge:    -> Deep understanding and experience of systems functionality core to oil trading or other physical commodities.    -> Deep understanding of the data flows between systems upstream and downstream of the Middle Office applications.    -> Experience of the full software delivery lifecycle - Good to Have Skills:    -> Deep understanding of business process, in particular relating to Commodity Risk/Product Control    -> Professional Scrum Master I (Fundamental) Assessment from scrum.org    -> Practical experience of operating in Agile development environments    -> Experience in toolsets for handling requirements, for example, JIRA, SharePoint, HP Quality Centre, Microsoft TFS, etc.  Roles and Responsibilities: - Support and deliver IT solutions for the reporting of Profit & Loss and Exposure for Oil Trading. - Diverse and multi-skilled business analysts, developers, testers and operational analysts all working together in a DevOps model, supporting global users. - Work in an Agile environment, and will be expected to engage in activities such as sprint planning, daily scrums, reviews and retrospectives. - Support the Lead Business Analyst in providing requirements elicitation, handling partner relationships, process change, testing, project delivery and service delivery. - Collaborate with our partners in Commodity Risk to analyse and prioritise our product backlog items. - Build detailed test scenarios, validating these with business change and product owners and work alongside other delivery teams on integrated changes to assess the impact of changes across our system landscape. - Serve as a trusted advisor across Global Oil, known for your deep commercial understanding of physical and derivatives trading. - Commit to the maintenance of Middle Office Technology intellectual property, and are expected to be an authority in relevant functional domains.   Please send your application to applicants@geco.asia with (JOB_000620) in Subject line and highlighting:  - Your relevant experience - Current/expected salary - Availability information - A latest MS-WORD Resume   **We regret that only short-listed applicants will be contacted.**  GECO Asia values the data privacy rights of our customers, associates, partners and prospective applicants. The same can be found here (https://www.geco.asia/about/privacy-policy) Note: GECO Asia is a German IT Services company and provides specialist IT resources on project and permanent basis. job_desc: Roles and Responsibilities a. Work with multiple groups of business, technical stakeholders and vendors to act as the principal touch point between these groups. b. Understand current business processes and elicit business, system requirement and improvement needed to optimize business rules, workflow processes and batch jobs to ensure nimble and flexible system. c. Conduct analysis by reviewing source code and technical specifications with consideration of WINS tech stack and design principles. d. Propose TO-BE system interfaces and gain alignment with relating systems/modules. e. Document, validate, de-conflict and provide necessary impact analysis of system requirements supporting the business processes in user stories form for stakeholders’ signoff. Build narratives and acceptance criteria for the stories in all iterations of system development and manage the story backlog with stakeholders and product owner during build and test.  f. Defining interface and test specification with external systems for integration/interfacing. g. Work with vendors to interpret user stories leading to technical implementation. h. Work with vendors to develop data mapping and conversion strategy for migration of legacy data to the new system, verify and accept migrated data; i. Be the liaison between vendors and business to support testing of build system, validate automated acceptance tests, manages formal User Acceptance Testing (UAT) including tracking of defect rates and conduct system trainings. j. Support Product Owner and manage vendors to deliver product in an Agile development environment and ensuring various Agile ceremonies are conducted correctly.

job_desc:
WINS PO is developing and implementing a new Work Pass Integrated Systems (WINS) using Agile software development methodology.
We invite interested applicants who are passionate about change and transformation to join WINS PO as UX Designer and take on the exciting and challenging roles of designing, developing and implementing our new WINS online service.
 
A.           Responsibilities:
As a UX Designer, you will:

Work with internal and external stakeholders and act as the principal touch point between them and the development and design team
Research and investigate user needs and processes, ideate and recommend improvement
Prepare mock-ups to communicate, test and refine concepts with stakeholders through an iterative process
Document, validate and clarify the system requirements supporting the defined business processes in user stories form
Improve usability, accessibility and interaction with the product to enhance user satisfaction.
Lead and support product show case and provide feedback to the development team
Support testing of build system, validate automated acceptance tests, manage formal User Acceptance Testing (UAT) including tracking of defect rates

 
B.           Requirements:

Have experience in Software engineering, IT and/Business/ Analysis, User Experience or Interaction Design
Have experience working with Agile development process
Good analytical, writing, communication and interpersonal skills
Be a team player and able to work in a fast paced and open environment
Have an eye for details and patterns 
Able to multi-task, take initiative and work independently with multiple stakeholders

- Responsible to gather, analyse and formalise user’s business requirements and processes, evaluate on feasibility of implementation and manage scope of project. - Gather, analyse and formalise user’s business requirements and processes, evaluate on feasibility of implementation and manage scope of project. - Prepare project documentation such as Requirement Specifications/Use Case Specifications etc Adhere to project scope, update requirement traceability matrix, inform and record out-of-scope issues. - Develop technical design specification and translate technical design into process/program specification. Involve in the design review session. - Make changes to configurable items, which include hardware, software, documentation, etc.  -  Participate in Coding and Code Review. - Assist in the integration testing, system testing, User Acceptance Test & implementation activities.   - Prepare user manual and operations manual, and plan & facilitate training of users and operators.  - Provide post implementation support (including production support and service requests). - Escalate and discuss critical issues such as scope creep with the relevant managers. - Conduct requirement gathering sessions. Conduct gap analysis of current business process to identify improvement opportunities.
job_req: - Typically 2-4 years IT experience - Familiar with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) - Ability to produce specifications for documentations and implementations -  Experience in IT business analysis techniques -  Degree Holder  -  Self-motivated with a positive “can-do” attitude, creative with excellent presentation, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills including strong persuasive techniques.   Licence No: 12C6060

job_desc: About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit.  It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Lean Six Sigma Business Analyst will be responsible for identifying impactful opportunities for operational improvements across end to end value streams in the organization. He/she is also responsible for building a Lean Six Sigma mindset and lead Lean Six Sigma initiatives across the organization.                                                                                             He/She is also responsible for creating an environment that promotes continuous improvement of business processes, increases efficiency, increases consistency, reduces pain points, reduce wastes in the processes and empowers team members to enhance the value of the service they provide to our stakeholders This is achieved by ensuring;  Stakeholder engagement Team Engagement Project/Program Management Benefit Realization  Responsibilities  Challenging the status quo, Thought Leadership and Lead Six Sigma Initiatives Coach and mentor teams and change leaders on Lean thinking, standard lean systems, tools, techniques, mindsets and behaviours  Enable implementation of Lean Six Sigma Initiatives across the organization Support change leaders through each phase of deployment, including the development of a process-specific plan for design, pilot, and sustain phases  Delivering change in a structured manner where all inflight deliverables are tracked, reported against, and delivered Senior Stakeholder Management, Program Management and Risk Management Able to use data to influence senior leaders and defend his/her perspective  Ensure the book of work is clearly articulated and delivered for each process work-stream Driving program / project working group meetings Adding valuable inputs into the overall scope of delivery Managing project budget where applicable Reporting project status into the program manager Coordinating workshops Benefit Realization  Key Stakeholders  Technology Services
job_req: Our Ideal Candidate This role would require 10+ years of relevant experience in the following key capabilities:  Champion and Lead Lean Six Sigma Initiatives Extensive use of Lean Six Sigma tool and technologies Demonstrated ability to coach and train all levels of leaders  Usage of Minitab or any statistical tool MS SharePoint MS Project MS PowerPoint MS Excel  Knowledge and experience in the following areas would be a strong advantage;  Lean Six Sigma Certification (Black Belt or Master Black Belt)  The following soft skills and experience is also a strong advantage:  Experience operating at a group level of sizeable international companies, including engaging senior technology stakeholders. Experience in highly regulated environments, particularly banking/finance, with a strong awareness of security/risk principles, as well as the criticality of data control. Leadership qualities. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills: written and verbal, and being able to tailor content to both business and technical audiences. Multi-cultural awareness and sensitivity; able to interact with teams based in multiple geographies. Ability to build a strong network within Target; has the ability to leverage resources and relationships to get things done Passionate about leading process improvement and applying lean techniques in different environments to deliver greater value to the guest   Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  How to Apply Click here ( https://scb.taleo.net/careersection/jobdetail.ftl?job=1900008096&lang=en ) to apply now and take the next step in fulfilling your potential You can search and view current opportunities across our organization and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com and selecting Careers. To help speed up your application, please note the following:  You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information) We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application  It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience. Diversity & Inclusion Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. job_desc: Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Responsibilities  1. Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues 9. Owns and manages process repository and is responsible for maintenance of all processes in the domain/sub-domain (Business Process Management)

The ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, including executives, subject matter experts, developers 4. Pro-active and able to organize, coordinate, and direct users and teams 5. Familiar with project management and SDLC process and writing Business Requirement Document & Functional Specification 6. Process positive attitudes and able to adopt to changes fast 7. Working experience in Banking environments will be an advantage 8. Having mobile applications and payments knowledge will be an advantage 9. Delivery focused and results oriented 10. Ability to work independently, and keep calm when under stress    Knowledge (Domain and Technologies) 1. Microsoft Excel/Powerpoint/Projects/Word/Visio 2. Understanding and hands-on experience in both Agile and Waterfall approaches in SDLC 9. Familiar with HPQC, Jira and Confluence tools will be an advantage

job_desc: The ideal candidate shall be a team player who will be working closely with business and technical teams to serve as an liaison between users and developers. He/She is also required to deliver business and functional specification, perform data analysis on supply chain data to identify trend and issues, as well as to make proposal for improvements. Support in planning for supply chain activities and the supply chain application systems

job_desc: The Job   Executing Business Analysis best practices and Engagement of Stakeholders across Front-to-Back functions. Extensive experience in feasibility studies and functional analysis of business requirements. Ensuring that the services delivered conforms with, and contributes to the development of the business strategy. In Process of defining any new functionality, future enhancements should be considered, so that there will be place holder for future enhancements. Assess the impacts on the project plans resulting from change requests, adhoc projects, or technology issues. Coordinating with various users groups and interface teams and getting them on board as interface services for various financial services. Managing stakeholders, risks, issues, quality, and project controls. Work closely with the technical implementation team in bridging the gap from translating functional to technical details Provide functional Guidance to the Team, working closely with developers/Tech Leads for assisting in resolution of queries

job_desc: Industry Platform Pte. Ltd. Is a Singapore incorporated firm specialising in business matching via global, industry specific conferences. The firm places a strong emphasis on the production of quality content for our events. With strong networks in the energy & telecommunications space, we provide the best platforms for industry insiders to network and keep abreast of developments In South East Asia, Asia IoT Business Platform offers the region's most comprehensive event for solution providers targeting enterprise adoption Internet of Things Technologies. 25 editions of Asia IoT Business Platform have been held in various locations around South East Asia with over 6,000 participants involved till date. In 2019, Asia IoT Business Platform will be hosting our series of conferences in Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam and Myanmar. Reporting to the Managing director of the firm, the Internet of Things - Business Development Analyst is a role that will focus on business development activities for our Internet of Things Conference.  A confident team player, the IoT business development Anaylst should also be an independent project manager, demonstrating resourcefulness and attention to detail.  Responsibilities: •    Engage Global IoT stakeholders to drive Sponsorship and Delegate Sales for the Conference •    Manage Global IoT Stakeholders post conference •    Take the lead, working with editorial colleagues and the Conference Producer, on realising the potential of social media to drive awareness our events, and generate sales/sales leads. •    Other responsibilities as assigned.

job_desc: About DBS   DBS is the World’s Best Digital Bank. We put digital priorities at the heart of banking, designing and creating products and services to help our customers. Digital innovation pervades every part of the bank, from our consumer banking arm to corporate banking arm. With a strong culture of innovation, experimenting with new technology and collaboration with the FinTech community, we aim to simplify banking so we can help others Live More, Bank Less.   The Opportunity   We’re looking for technologists across varying levels all over the world to be part of a major transformation programme to reimagine banking.    Based in Singapore, you’ll be leveraging the latest technology to develop mission critical applications from scratch. You’ll design, develop, test and deploy new applications as part of the strategic transformation programme, using Agile, cloud technologies, microservices and Big Data.   Business Function     Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.       Responsibilities     Support Test Manager to oversee respective SG Finance and Risk applications testing activities Develop the test plan for the tasks, dependencies and participants required to mitigate the risks to system quality and obtain stakeholder support for this plan Document, implement, monitor, and enforce all processes for testing as per defined standards Lead the automation of the testing process in-sprint and during SIT using the right tool set – Licensed and Open source Responsible for developing and enriching Test Automation framework using Selenium, Junit, TestNG, Serenity, JavaScript & related technologies  Responsible for executing software Test Automation development from conceptual phase to testing phase.  Working with vendors and business analyst and End Users within organization. Responsible for mentoring junior testers/developers
job_req: 10-12 years of experience in the field of financial/banking applications testing and a broad experience in leading the testing on large complex projects/programmes as a lead or manager Strong experience in agile methodologies and TDD/BDD. Strong technical knowledge – able to code in one or two scripting language Experience in test automation and developing automation frameworks from scratch Experience automating testing in multiple technologies – Mainframe, web, Java/.Net. Experience automating through the UI, API and web services Advanced knowledge of test methodologies and approaches  Experience of using and implementing a variety of test tools, including tools for test management / planning, defect tracking, test automation, test data management Experience with Agile and Testing Tools e.g. Selenium, HPQC, UFT/QTP, OPTIM, JIRA, Confluence would be an advantage Experience working directly with and managing vendors and partners Pro-active, independent, resourceful and able to work in a team Experience of Finance and Risk domain and applications required.  Familiarity with Mainframe, modern 3-tier applications & related technologies (e.g. Java/J2EE, SQL/Oracle, UNIX) Experience with VB scripting, REST and MS Excel scripting would be an advantage    Desired    A Bachelor’s degree or higher preferably in Computer Science or IT Additional experience on developing service based application Excellent analytical skills; Proficient in MS Office and able to produce board-level documentation Fluency in written and spoken English; Good communication and interpersonal skills Self-starter who sets and meets challenging personal targets; Detailed person, with a big picture outlook Understanding of current technologies employed by Tier 1 Investment Banking Institutions Must be a team player

job_desc: The Risk Division acts as a guardian of the Bank's risk appetite and provides effective independent risk oversight in the areas of regulatory and risk related systems and infrastructure as well as maintaining a comprehensive bank wide risk appetite framework including market risk, credit risk, operational risk and reputational risk. We are continuously strengthening the function by attracting, developing and retaining top talent and cultivating continuous learning throughout the organization. You will learn how to hone your skills and apply them in a fast-paced, risk oriented environment as part of a project team or one of our many Risk functions.
job_req: To apply for this role, you are in your final year of an undergraduate program (graduating between December 2018 – June 2019).   Credit Suisse is noted for the diversity of its employees, but seeks colleagues with a common set of abilities – highly motivated and creative individuals who have demonstrated academic achievement, and have the ability to work independently and as a member of a team. We’ll be looking at your potential, your ability, your academic background and your extracurricular activities. We’re looking to build future leaders who add fresh and diversity perspectives to our business.   Whatever your background, you’ll need to be:  A leader who engenders dedication, assumes responsibility and mobilizes others A critical thinker with excellent analytical skills An enthusiastic self-starter who achieves significant results A supportive and adaptable team member who can build strong relationships An articulate communicator who also recognizes the importance of listening Principled and committed to the highest standards of ethical behavior

analysis and definition with business Co-create connected data models for customer insights, data led design, operational use and potential monetisation  ACCOUNTABILITIES Key Results Areas  Understand Looks beyond the obvious (decision quality, problem solving, business acumen) Self-Management - spends time on what’s important, eliminates roadblocks, can utilise resources to get things done Encourages collaboration, is a team player Priority Setting, Planning, Maintains Organisation and Peer relationships Business Skills – translation of Business needs to Outcome Customer focus Negotiations, Conflict management and relationship building Integrity and Trust Change agent Resourceful Analytical skills to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements Facilitation skills to lead requirements elicitation workshops Organizational skills to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information An understanding of contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practice; familiarity with requirements engineering books and resources Property domain knowledge is a plus

job_desc: What you will be involved with as a Business Analyst at SG Digital:  You will be working alongside Product Managers, Development Managers, Project Managers, Software Architects and Senior Software Engineers to shape the technology and product vision of the team that will drive forward our strategic product initiatives. Opportunity to work directly with the key business stakeholders and Product Owners The candidate will be skilled in defining and creating both functional and non-functional requirements and in supervising the conversion of these into Agile user stories for use by all members of a software development team.    Additional Information Why would you enjoy working with us at SG Digital?  Competitive benefits, an open and supportive environment as well as a modern and exciting workplace The opportunity to interact with global teams on a regular basis and the possibility to switch teams and projects as you and our business continues to develop and grow Tangible and genuine development - at SG Digital, you can take your career where you want it to go! Exposure to real work, business-critical projects and the chance to develop some of the world’s leading e-commerce sportsbooks whilst working on exciting client projects and interact with lots of code!  And if that’s not enough; you will get to enjoy a great work location and flexible working whilst we provide you with the guidance and development skills you need to progress quickly and enhance your career.
job_req: Key Accountabilities  Create business requirements and define user stories for use by SCRUM cross-functional teams. Analyse results of product solutions and report on customer acceptance. Engage with customers and product managers to define new functionality and document this in user stories. Communicate with both business and technical colleagues and customers in an appropriate manner and using a range of techniques.    Key Responsibilities  Working with customers to extract business requirements . Evaluating business problems and proposing solutions to allow customers to meet these, either through software or changes to the existing processes. Training, walk-throughs and demos of our products and development to customers and how they may be used with existing business practices - else how business practices may be modified to work with our platform. Serving as a liaison by pro-actively communicating and collaborating with customers and SG Digital development teams to evaluate solutions to customer requirements. Reconciling conflicts if necessary in an effort to achieve the optimum solution. Providing excellent verbal and written communication skills whilst interacting with a diverse group of people, internally and externally.    Qualifications & Experience  7+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst role in an online industry Leadership experience Demonstrable experience in defining and implementing comprehensive product strategies for complex IT projects working in Agile environments, with a heavy emphasis on user stories and acceptance criteria  through to production deployment, also with focus on non-functional requirements. Experience in contributing to company strategic planning or responsibility for departmental strategy. Proven communication and presentation skills. job_desc: We think bigger than an agency and more creatively than a consultancy with the power to integrate the whole system. We are IBM iX 2014 and 2015 Advertising Age’s largest digital agency network in the world, leader in Gartner’s 2018 Magic Quadrant for Global Digital Marketing Agencies and rated by IDC as Leader in Digital Strategy in Asia Pacific. We are renegades and realists who blend strategy, technology and creativity to tackle every client challenge. We imagine the businesses that will shape tomorrow’s world and help our clients make them real. We uncover insights from data that others can’t see and deliver progressive ideas through the use of IBM Design Thinking. We ground every strategy with a focus on delivering the ultimate experience – for customers, for employees, for shareholders. Everything we do drives measurable impact at scale. For more information, visitibm.com/ibmix.   IBM iX is looking to hire a leadership position to lead the Design team, stationed in Singapore. We are looking for a self-motivated individual who is passionate about Digital engagement and want to learn new skills, work in multidisciplinary teams, and deliver excellent quality solutions to leading companies. The work iX delivers ranges from mobile services to Web, interactive kiosks, wearables, and digital interfaces embedded in physical environments and objects.   Job Description   As the Design Lead you sit at the top of the Design pyramid within IBM iX. You are comfortable engaging with client stakeholders, strategists, designers and technology teams to workshop and define future digital experiences. You contribute your ideas and your deep insights of human behaviour, experience design, usability, digital product, etc. with established design systems such as Apple or Google. You are comfortable in a highly agile and iterative environment where you translate business concepts into journeys, screen flows and interactions. You will be leading a team of talented UX designers, UI designers and Interaction designers and inspire them to turn ideas into engaging and intuitively usable interactive experience concepts for omni-channel digital products and services.    This role will utilize a high-level analytical ability and creativity to address ambiguous, large, complex/new problems and projects and apply IBM Design thinking to determine priority, scope and relationships of existing and proposed solutions. Candidates in this role will lead discussions and presentations for both working and delivery purposes and effectively communicate process on all engagements and have measurable successful deliveries. A significant level of customer and stakeholder interaction is required across ASEAN and will require significant travel across ASEAN.   This role requires Subject Matter Expertise (SME) in the following capabilities:    Design Thinking and human-centric problem-solving. Service Design, Design Systems, Design operation Create visually compelling representations of the solution's high-level interaction, navigation, and organization design (i.e., concept models). Develop visual representations of the organizational structure, hierarchy, and relationships of screens in a site (i.e., site maps). Develop visual representations of the interactions between the user and the functional modules in the solution. Deep knowledge surrounding customer segments and behaviors across multiple industries. Conduct and analyze C-level stakeholder interviews to understand key success factors for a project or pursuit Customer segments and behaviors across multiple industries. Leading and organizing a team of user experience and visual designers across multiple locations. Practical experience of delivery, including running multiple cross-functional squads, overseeing design processes.    The role also involves  Provide thought leadership in the creative and design field, i.e. experience design, service design, digital products, etc. Knowledge of state of the art and emerging digital design trends, and how new technologies impact these trends. Extensive travel across ASEAN region.

job_desc: Role Purpose Responsible for the cross-functional analysis of the business requirements for improving processes and systems, applications support, and implementation of business systems and enhancements in line with business direction and needs. Role Accountabilities Strategic & Planning  Provide consultancy and expertise advice on matters of Application’s architecture and integration with other systems, including their feasibility. Responsible for partnering with business representatives to understand business processes and underlying informational and/or process automation needs, then translating those needs into formal, documented business requirements following methodologies and processes. Perform cross functional analysis of the company’s operations, business and functional requirements and recommend or provide application solutions. Performs investigational analysis and evaluation to determine application feasibility. Developing project feasibility reports and discussing them with business users with regards to future implementation.  IT Operations Management  Applications operational support including issues analysis and resolution relating to supported applications and interfaces. Documenting the specifications, design, features and operation of applications to a Functional /Technical specification which is used by the applications development team for translation into actual program code. Testing and debugging application systems and perform quality control checks before releasing the system for UAT. Data migration analysis to new applications as needed. Perform research, plans and propose a solution, recommend software or hardware components to ensure that the company’s business/ operational requirements are met. Coordinate and link-up various systems within the organisation to increase compatibility and improve information access and sharing. Work with 3rd party vendors for applications support and/or changes. Involve in monthly applications server windows patch testing.  Risk Management  Plan and conduct routine audits of systems and software. Prepare and maintain documentation, including procedures, system specifications, technical documentation and user manuals Manage all applications change requests and/or enhancements to ensure timely and accurate dispositions. Ensure that IT Request procedures are established and enforced. Providing IT support for regulatory and compliance activities.  Project Management  Support the analysis of business initiatives; provide input to the development of business cases and project measurement objectives. Support the development of cost and benefit estimates to establish project worth, including the development of alternatives and recommendations for new acquisitions or changes to existing applications or equipment. Prepare feasibility studies; recommends and establishes program objectives, priorities and schedules in conjunction with user and functional requirements and conducts end-user training, as needed, for assigned applications. Works with business stakeholders and/or vendor for project acceptance tests. Managing overall coordinate of IT applications development projects from planning through implementation. Including on setting up project scope, priorities and deliverable schedules in line with the business users. Facilitating discussions and consensus among various project stakeholders.  Safety  Take responsibility for the safety of myself and those around me by displaying safety leadership principles (i.e. Safety I’s & Accountability ladder). Challenging and stopping unsafe acts and behaviours or unsafe conditions. Comply with the Global Safety Standards, Polices and Operating Procedures.
