job_desc: SAP data architect The SAP data Architect position will have the opportunity to be integrally involved in and influence the data architecture of the new SAP 4/Hana project that will shape the future of data, reporting and analytics of the company.  You will be working in a challenging, fast-paced and rewarding environment, with other like-minded peers who are solutions and results-oriented, and who enjoy collaboration. Responsibilities:  Architecting highly-scalable, distributed enterprise data solutions with a focus on big data platforms and enterprise data warehouses for reporting & analytics, and a particular focus on HANA-based data platforms Designing and developing highly scalable and flexible data platform solutions Designing and documenting data architecture and data management policies and rules Providing active “hands-on” architectural guidance and leadership through the entire lifecycle of development projects Translating business requirements into conceptual and detailed technology solutions Collaborating closely with other architects and peers across the organization architecting and delivering solutions Performing third-party vendor assessments Keeping fluent in industry and marketplace evolution; continuously learning new data technologies and introducing these into the organization Cross-training peers and mentoring junior teammates
job_req: Requirements:  10 years of hands-on data platform design and development in large-scale and complex environments In-depth expertise and experience with SAP HANA Experience with HANA data modeling and integrating HANA with source data systems and BI tools Expertise architecting and delivering highly-scalable enterprise data solutions Fluent understanding of data security and compliance requirements and experience designing data solutions that are secure and compliant Fluent in architecting and documenting architecture at multiple levels (high-level to detailed) and across multiple views (conceptual, logical, physical, data flow and sequence diagrams) Understanding and experience with Solutions Architecture methodology and practices Practical experience designing data solutions in multiple models and technologies: relational, no-SQL, big data, graph DB, unstructured and structured Experience and expertise with data lifecycle management, data-tiering and data archiving Experience migrating legacy systems to modern solutions Familiarity and working experience with common data integration patterns and processes including: ETL, APIs, Messaging Bus, Pub-Sub, flat files... Experience and expertise in data management: data governance, data mastering, meta-data management, data taxonomies and ontologies, lineage...

job_desc: Responsible for Windows OS security configuration / hardening for Windows Operating Systems in accordance with the established Bank’s Windows Security Standards and industry baseline standards (CIS). Perform Windows server takeover and hardening verification processes for Windows Operating Systems. Conduct Windows server takeover process and security hardening compliance check for Windows and Active Directory. Assess the security access control for bank-wide Windows servers by performing pre-production compliance checking. Periodically conducting user access review for systems and applications. Assist in developing and establish access control baseline, processes and procedures to ensure open system environment is properly and accurately secure in accordance with the regulatory, bank and industry standards. Provide technical expertise in the area of Windows security matters and work closely with Application Development team to establish and develop application access control matrix. Grant and assign access privileges based on the approved access control matrix for Windows platforms. Troubleshoot access and privilege issues. Identify and rectify issues, as well as proper escalation to management. Provide appropriate technical guidance and advisory on Windows platforms security matters. Implementation and administration of System Access Control within Windows. Knowledge/experience in Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL) and Network (Firewalls/Routers) is preferred. Knowledge/experience in Big Data technologies will be an added advantage. Knowledge/experience in Firewall/Network Management will be an added advantage. Knowledge/experience in VMWare and CyberArk technologies will be an added advantage. Knowledge/experience in DevSecOps technologies will be added advantage.
job_req: Degree Holder with at least 10 years of relevant experience in performing Windows Security administration, with strong analytical and problem solving skills Conversant and with considerable hands on experience with Windows technologies Conversant with end-user (Windows, IOS and Android) and endpoint management (MDM, McAfee ePO, Microsoft Intune, Blackberry/GOOD) technologies. Good written and communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of managers, subject matter experts and operators. Team player, including ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with all levels within an organization, fostering collaboration internally/externally with vendors and staff.

job_desc: Project Overview Part of the FM research agenda involves the development of the SimMobility platform for the microsimulation of land use and transportation interactions.   SimMobility is an agent-based simulator that links together various mobility-sensitive behavioral models with state-of-the-art simulators to predict impacts of mobility demands, infrastructure changes, and evolving transportation options on the deployment and delivery of people, firms, services and freight.  This particular Postdoctoral Associate will focus on the so-called ‘long-term’ module of SimMobility. The behavioral models in the long-term, agent-based simulator address household residential choice, vehicle availability, firm location and real-estate markets in a manner that is tightly integrated with an activity-based ‘mid-term’ model that estimates agent-specific ‘logsum’ accessibility measures for simulated daily activity patterns. The overall scope of FM research includes a number of projects on the development, and analysis of new and advanced forms of mobility options (such as on-demand mobility and autonomous vehicles), as well as on their urban planning and management implications.  Both FM, and the SMART Centre, encourage exploration of new ideas and the use of ‘big data’ to advance our understanding of behavioral choices, urban activity patterns and the adoption of new forms of mobility. Responsibilities Depending upon project assignment and postdoc skills and interests, the specific responsibilities will involve some combination of the following:  Enhancing, estimating and calibrating the behavioral models in the long-term simulator, Generating and updating synthetic populations of residents, firms, and workers for particular cities at various points in time, Performing complex data analysis and integration of geospatial datasets, Contributing to the design and initiation of new research projects and ideas related to household and firm behavior as new options evolve for urban mobility and freight delivery, Presenting research results at international workshops, conferences, and exhibits as well as at internal project meetings, Co-authoring articles for publication in top-tier, peer-reviewed journals and conferences, and Monitoring the progress of project components, supervising PhD students, and regularly meeting with Principle Investigators.
job_req: The successful candidate must hold a doctoral degree in Urban Planning, Transportation Engineering, Econometrics or a related field. Candidates with experience in urban modeling and data science will have an added advantage. Additionally, they should enjoy working in a multidisciplinary team environment that values problem solving skills and creativity.  Advanced skill and experience in data processing and analysis is required. Expertise in agent-based modeling, urban-scale transport modeling; and/or behavioral economics and real-estate markets is desired. Knowledge of urban economics, discrete choice models, geoprocessing, and database management is expected. Experience with programming in scientific languages (e.g. Python and R) is necessary. Familiarity with object-oriented programming languages (e.g. C++ and Java) is desired. Independent thinking and innovative scientific accomplishments demonstrated via published papers is expected. Outstanding oral and written communication skills in English is required.  The Postdoctoral Associate will work with an integrated team of faculty, researchers and students from MIT and Singapore University partners, including (among others): Professors Joseph Ferreira, Christopher Zegras, and Moshe Ben-Akiva of MIT. Interested applicants should submit the following:  A motivation letter (one or two pages) stating the applicant's interest in working with the Lab, research areas and/or projects of particular relevance, key competencies, and anticipated date of availability, A full CV, including degrees, relevant projects and positions with dates, and key relevant publications (up to 5), and Names and contact information of three references.    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
comp: SINGAPORE-MIT ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY CENTRE

job_desc: We are looking to fill a postdoctoral position in the area of complex urban systems. The selected candidate will have a unique opportunity to carry out a truly interdisciplinary work with an international team of outstanding researchers within the group. The primary focus will be to carry out data analytics on big data sets associated with human dynamics through a network analytical lens.
job_req: Ph.D. degree in Computational Geography, Physics, Computational Science or a related field. Research expertise in complexity science, network science and discrete numerical simulations will be considered a plus.  Solid working knowledge in Python coding. Ability to work both independently and in a team environment, and to take ownership of, and autonomously carry forward, major aspects of a research project. Ability of approaching research problems with a system view, of working in a multidisciplinary team environment, problem solving skills and high creativity. Strong publication record, as well as excellent verbal and written communication skills.

job_desc: Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team rewarded with innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive. As an experienced Infrastructure Development professional, your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and technologists toward creating next-level solutions that improve the way our business is run. Your hands-on knowledge in system design, application development, testing and operational stability will help your team deliver high quality products. You’ll be instrumental in solving more difficult technical issues, developing integration elements, building data models, APIs, and open 3rd-party SDKs. You’ll see your ideas come to life as part of a small, success-driven team. Your quest to embracing leading-edge technologies and methodologies inspires your team to follow suit. And best of all, you’ll be able to harness massive amounts of brainpower through our global network of technologists from around the world to tackle big challenges. Key Responsibilities will include design and implementation of enterprise grade solutions for technical data management, including data sourcing, ingestion, persistence, and presentation – while ensuring quality of deliverables and adhering to standards in areas of code quality, secure coding, test coverage, monitoring, logging, exception management, operability and maintainability. You will be expected to excel and lead in a team environment, demonstrate strong interpersonal skills, collaborate and build relationships with other development teams, operations partners and business clients.
job_req: This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: •BS/BA degree or equivalent experience •Provide technical expertise throughout the software lifecycle including design, implementation and delivery. •Understanding cloud , virtualization, APIs, and modern software languages •Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages: Java, Python, C, C++, GoExperience with developing frameworks that helps increasing developer and release velocity, improving code health and technical standards •Advanced experience working with two or more from the following: web application development,  database, unix/linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, information retrieval, networking, large scale software development, security software development •Understanding or have experience with agile and lean philosophies •Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills with clear communication •Ability to collaborate with different roles to achieve common goals •Minimum 10 years of hands-on full development lifecycle experience (preferably on Java based platforms) with extensive experience in designing and developing large scale, mission critical enterprise grade software. Experience with debugging, performance profiling and optimization. •Minimum 4 years experience with big data/NoSQL (Hive/Hbase/Solr/Spark/Cassandra/elasticsearch) – including understanding of cluster-topology and sharding/partitioning. •Possess at least 3 years of message driven development (Kafka or Tibco EMS, MQ) experience for high volume based platforms and scalable distributed systems •Experience in highly scalable REST/web service, caching servers, SOAP, HTTPS. When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.   At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.  We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation.  If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.  We strongly encourage all applicants to apply via our careers website where you are able join our Talent Network to receive customized vacancy notifications and ensure that your details are accessible by our global recruiting team - www.jpmorganchase.com/careers. A quick link to this particular job posting can be found in this URL: http://jobs.jpmorganchase.com/ListJobs/ByKeyword/180105195/ Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified. We thank you for your interest and wish you all the best in your career. Yours Sincerely, Human Resources JPMorgan

job_desc: Vacancy is to lead the data stream for HCL's Digital and Analytics practice. It’s a regional role – based out of Singapore and will need the candidate to travel to our key geographies – Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines and Hong Kong. The role is to understand customer’s requirement related to data streams (right from traditional data warehouse to big data solutions encompassing facades of data science, data governance, business intelligence and analytics). It will also require candidate to draw up solutions for customer’s requirements and work with HCL’s partner ecosystem to ensure solution covers an end-to-end data proposition. For this role candidate will have to work with multiple streams within organization namely Sales, Delivery and HCL’s Center of Excellences. HCL envisages that candidate must have a strong knowhow of data related technologies and good interpersonal skills to work as productive team member.
job_req: Technical / Professional Skills 1. At least 14 years of collective experience in Information Management stacks ( ODI, Informatica, Talend etc) and modern data platforms (CDH,HDP, spark etc)  2. At least 4 years of experience in setting up data and analytics solution on major cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS, IBM, Oracle  etc)  3. At least 10 years of experience in Business Intelligence(IBM Cognos, OBIEE) and data Visualization (Tableau, QlikSense, PowerBI etc). 4. At least 6 years of experience in Enterprise Performance Management(Cognos TM1, Cognos Controller, CDM, Hyperion etc). 5. A proven thought-leader who delivered complex data and analytics projects across various domains BFSI, CPG, Telecom, Healthcare etc.   Non-Technical / Soft Skills 1. HCL is looking for a experienced data & insight Practitioner to develop & deliver ASEAN market strategy.  2. He/she will support defining the go to market platforms, services, offerings and capabilities to drive business value for clients.  3. He/she will provide consulting to transform clients towards modern data driven organization by leveraging cost effective solutions ~ Cloud first, hadoop data lake, Mobility etc.  4. He/she will orchestrate Client PoC's, manage RFI/RFP's and engage in customer presales activities. 5. As well as understanding and providing thought leadership on data solution strategy, best of breed technology platforms(for Big data, DW, BI, EPM, Visualization etc) as per client use cases.

job_desc: As Senior Cloud Database Admin, you will design and develop database structures and schemas, analyze client workflow, determine the best solutions for a successful project, and share knowledge of database, big data or data analytics. As a part of the team, you will help the teams adopt to cloud native database solutions. To be successful in this role the candidate must have deep knowledge cloud data technologies and align technology solutions to specific business objectives. As Senior Cloud Database Admin you will:  Automate the build, operation, backup, restore, and monitoring of databases used across NTUC Develop and evaluate database infrastructure performance criteria and measurement methods Support day-to-day operations and management of an enterprise level production database in the cloud Monitors user access and performance of the database systems Create best practices for cloud database operations Participation in maintenance windows and on-call rotation is required Contributing to other support and automation efforts as needed
job_req: Minimum of 10 Years of relevant work experience required Very strong and solid experience of database administration in a cloud environment. Experience with replication/clustering and partitioning a must Experience writing and executing stress tests on databases and services Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database problems Very good Knowledge of indexes, index management, statistics, data-at-rest encryption, secure connectivity Experience with Big Data concepts and technologies, especially using AWS or GCP (ex: MongoDB, Redshift, etc.) Experience with cloud database technologies (ex: AWS RDS, Redshift, DynamoDB, MS SQL, etc.)

job_desc: We are seeking experienced and motivated professionals to join our Information Technology group in Singapore. You will be part of our new IT Global Innovation Center focused on developing and applying advanced capabilities in information sciences, information security, mobility, social media and big data. You will have the opportunity to work with regional and global teams to identify and tackle the biggest opportunities and challenges at the intersection of healthcare, information and technology. Overall, our new Global Innovation Center offers opportunities to learn from others across the globe, and to enjoy a rewarding career that helps to save lives. You will under the direction of Business Operations COE Lead, you will be responsible for providing value-adding services, primarily to Asia Pacific region Business Operations team and its stakeholders. You will manage and support IT Business Operations and financial management workload in line with internal governance and corporate policies.  Primary Job Responsibilities:   • Business and Financial Operations o Provide PO management services from planning, creation, tracking to closing o Manage accruals, depreciation, amortization, intercompany chargeback o Preparation of COE financial data as inputs to forecast planning o Continuous monitoring to ensure compliance to financial policies and procedures.  • Support financial activities in the IT Investment portfolio: o Work with Project Management Organization to support them from the project accounting perspective  o Projects reporting and financial status updates in SAP • Manage any new requirements needed including new projects or changes to current projects/programs: o SAP project creation, approval and closure, financial resource scheduling. • Identify areas to streamline / improve process to eliminate waste (time/cost) • Provide regular and on-demand report for financial management • Work in a networked organization in partnership with Business Management, Supplier Management, Procurement, and Finance to deliver on financial management objectives   General Responsibilities:   • Perform, adopt and where necessary adjust processes supporting IT cost management. • Interact with senior level business executives & peers in the IT organization, regionally as well globally. • Build strong partnerships with IT leaders as well as counterparts in Finance, Procurement and HR. • Manage communication and change management activities. • Partner with peers in other business areas to identify and share best practices.
job_req: To be successful to the role, ideally, you will need to have a Bachelor Science Degree with relevant experience in Finance, Accounting, Math, Computer Science, Computer Engineering • At least 5 years of relevant work experience.  • Demonstrate self-starting ability, able to multitask and work independently in a dynamic environment.  • Excellent communication and facilitation skills and able to conduct effective user trainings.  To be successful to the role, ideally, you will need to have a Bachelor Science Degree with relevant experience in Finance, Accounting, Math, Computer Science, Computer Engineering • At least 5 years of relevant work experience.  • Demonstrate self-starting ability, able to multitask and work independently in a dynamic environment.  • Excellent communication and facilitation skills and able to conduct effective user trainings.  To be successful to the role, ideally, you will need to have a Bachelor Science Degree with relevant experience in Finance, Accounting, Math, Computer Science, Computer Engineering • At least 5 years of relevant work experience.  • Demonstrate self-starting ability, able to multitask and work independently in a dynamic environment.  • Excellent communication and facilitation skills and able to conduct effective user trainings.

job_desc: Introducing Tookitaki Tookitaki is providing machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. Incorporated in November 2014 in Singapore, the company is led by a core team with cumulative 30-years’ experience in finance, AI and big data analytics. Backed by institutional investors such as Jungle Ventures and Spring Seeds (a subsidiary of the Singapore Government), the company’s accolades include:   We are among the selected 21 companies which got accreditation from the government of Singapore for their stringent technology, finance and operations due diligence (www.imda.gov.sg/industry-development/programmes-and- grants/startups/accreditation-at-sgd)   We won the first place in the MAS FinTech Awards (Singapore SME) in the regulatory compliance space from the Monetary Authority of Singapore for our approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable (beyond ML based black box approach) (www.mas.gov.sg/News-and-Publications/Media- Releases/2016/Ten-FinTech-companies-recognised-for-innovative-solutions-at- inaugural-FinTech-Awards.aspx)   We are voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services space by medici (www.letstalkpayments.com/medici-top-21-ai-companies/)   We graduated from Nomura's corporate innovation program in November 2017 where we successfully delivered our product – Reconciliation Management Suite – in a pilot environment (https://inc42.com/buzz/nomura-voyager-fintech-accelerator-voyager- demo-day/) In regulatory compliance, we focus on anti-money laundering and reconciliation and our products – Alerts Management Suite (AMS) and Reconciliation Management Suite (RMS) – cater to these areas, respectively. The mission or goal is to achieve 40% operational efficiency with significant savings in infrastructure and operational costs. Tookitaki's unique selling proposition (USP) is in our approach where we combine our proprietary modelling technique with our complete auditable framework to make the process dynamic and highly explainable (moving out of the black box approach). Moreover, our flexible on-premise and cloud-packaging capabilities, along with the option of easy integration to exiting core-banking applications (REST API end points), make the solution deployment faster with lesser barrier to entry. Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail. Banks need to move beyond static rule-based systems and adopt a new approach to prevent financial and reputation loss. Tookitaki bridges the gap with its innovative software products – AMS, RMS and PMS.   careeers@tookitaki.com
job_req: Engineering/Research@Tookitaki The engineering/research team is responsible for building a robust predictive platform, which can add significant value to the BFSI vertical in solving operational and compliance risk problems. We take pride in building the system right and continuously evolving it. You have the freedom to choose right tools for the task. We encourage our engineers to participate in and contribute to open-source communities. Our Ideal Candidate Our engineering/research team is looking for a Lead Researcher with 6+ years’ solid research experience, who:   Is abreast with the state-of-the-art solutions related to evolving ML areas like Auto ML, explainable and interpretable ML, and online continuous learning.   Has deep interest and experience working on open-ended research problems in machine learning.   Would like to spend the next few years in implementing research ideas into product features to make an industry-wide impact.   Is well versed with computer science skills required to implement the algorithms on big data sets.   Has experience in parallelizing traditional algorithms to leverage advanced computing infrastructure and distributed systems.   Enjoys publishing research findings and presenting them at advanced ML conferences.   Would like to constantly experiment with new research ideas, find its applicability with our products to push the boundary forward. Desired Non-technical Requirements     Very strong communication skills both written and verbal   Strong desire to work with startups   Must be a team player Job Perks     Attractive variable compensation package   Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented   Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest technology spaces -- artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning

We take pride in building the system right and continuously evolving it. You have the freedom to choose right tools for the task. We encourage our engineers to participate in and contribute to open-source communities. Our Ideal Candidate Our engineering team is looking for a Implementation engineer with 3-6 years solid experience. The candidates responsibilities and required skills and experience are:  Managing the big data application stack including HDFS, YARN, Spark, Hive and Hbase Deeper understanding of all the configurations required for installing and maintaining the infrastructure in the long run Experience setting up high availability, configuring resource allocation, setting up capacity schedulers and configuring data level ACLs using Ranger, Sentry etc Experience working with and supporting middle layer technologies including web servers (httpd, ningx), application servers (Jboss, Tomcat) and database systems (postgres, mysql) Experience setting up enterprise security solution including setting up active directories, firewalls, SSL certificates, Kerberos KDC servers, etc Experience supporting on-premise solutions as well as on cloud - AWS and Azure. Experience working with containerized infrastructure and orchestration Experience with one or more automation tools - like Ansible, Teraform etc Experience working with CI / CD tools like Jenkins and various test report and coverage plugins Experience working with and supporting Java and Python based tech stacks would be a plus  Desired Non-technical Requirements  Very strong communication skills both written and verbal Strong desire to work with start-ups Must be a team player  Job Perks  Attractive variable compensation package Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest space in tech - artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning

job_desc: Introducing Tookitaki Tookitaki is providing machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. Incorporated in November 2014 in Singapore, the company is led by a core team with cumulative 150-years’ experience in financial crime, AI and big data analytics. Backed by institutional investors such as Jungle Ventures, Illuminate Financial and Enterprise Singapore (a subsidiary of the Singapore Government), the company’s accolades include:  We are among the selected 21 companies which got accreditation from the government of Singapore for their stringent technology, finance and operations due diligence (www.imda.gov.sg/industry-development/programmes-and-grants/startups/accreditation-at-sgd) We won the first place in the MAS FinTech Awards (Singapore SME) in the regulatory compliance space from the Monetary Authority of Singapore for our approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable (beyond ML based black box approach) (www.mas.gov.sg/News-and-Publications/Media-Releases/2016/Ten-FinTech-companies-recognised-for-innovative-solutions-at-inaugural-FinTech-Awards.aspx) We are voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services space by medici (www.letstalkpayments.com/medici-top-21-ai-companies/) We graduated from Nomura's corporate innovation program in November 2017 where we successfully delivered our product – Reconciliation Management Suite – in a pilot environment (https://inc42.com/buzz/nomura-voyager-fintech-accelerator-voyager-demo-day/)  In regulatory compliance, we focus on anti-money laundering and reconciliation and our products – Anti-Money Laundering Suite (AMLS) and Reconciliation Suite (RS) – cater to these areas, respectively. The mission or goal is to achieve 40% operational efficiency with significant savings in infrastructure and operational costs. Tookitaki's unique selling proposition (USP) is in our approach where we combine our proprietary modelling technique with our complete auditable framework to make the process dynamic and highly explainable (moving out of the black box approach). Moreover, our flexible on-premise and cloud-packaging capabilities, along with the option of easy integration to exiting core-banking applications (REST API end points), make the solution deployment faster with lesser barrier to entry. Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail. Banks need to move beyond static rule-based systems and adopt a new approach to prevent financial and reputation loss. Tookitaki bridges the gap with its innovative software products – AMLS and RS.
job_req: Role: VP, Sales Our Ideal Candidate Tookitaki is looking for a vice president, sales position who is responsible for establishing the sales targets to meet the company objectives. The person is responsible for developing strategic sales plans based on company goals that will promote sales growth and customer satisfaction for the organization. The key responsibilities of the position, among others, are:  Aggressively building a sales pipeline and developing, managing, and closing sales opportunities in the APAC market. Identifying prospects to approach while communicating the Tookitaki value proposition for their business and use cases. Developing business and marketing plans to grow opportunities using all tools available such as joint collateral, sales presentations, campaigns, webinars and events. Working cross-functionally with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, data science, marketing, legal, support, etc.) to execute on revenue plan. Managing a high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the machine learning solutions market. Getting deeply familiar with the machine learning market in order to communicate the Tookitaki value propositions and differentiation from other offerings. Giving effective Tookitaki demos to executives and business audiences. Developing strong working relationships with Tookitaki and field sales teams. Travelling to customer and partner sites as necessary  Qualifications  Experience in selling technology into FS accounts in the APAC region. Solid negotiation and analytical skills, and business and financial acumen. A proven record of high achievement in sales roles with a hunger to succeed Technical acumen to become conversant with machine learning and customer use cases in a shorter timeframe. Demonstrable pipeline generation experience, particularly building and executing on a multi-faceted territory plan. Ability to work independently in an extremely fast-paced environment and focus on the most important issues impacting outcomes. Excellent verbal and written communications skills are a must. Intellectual curiosity and the drive and passion to change the world. MBA or equivalent relevant business experience. Experience with start-ups, big data and analytic technologies is a huge plus.  Job Perks  Attractive variable compensation package Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest space in tech - artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning
address: HIGH STREET CENTRE, 1 NORTH BRIDGE ROAD 179094

job_desc: EY delivers unparalleled service in digital transformation, big data, data science, and digital analytics built on a blend of custom-developed methods related to customer analytics, data visualization, and optimization. We leverage best practices and a high degree of business acumen that has been compiled over years of experience to ensure the highest level of execution and satisfaction for our clients.  At EY, our methods are not tied to any specific platforms but rather arrived at by analysing business needs and making sure that the solutions delivered meet all client goals. We help our clients transform. Together we are changing the way they interact with their customers, employees and partners alike. We are modernizing their applications, creating new ones and driving business efficiency across their ever-changing platform and channel infrastructures. Everything we do centers around this simple story.   The opportunity   As a member of the team at EY Wavespace (EY’s global network of innovation and growth centres), you will have the opportunity to work with our most important local, regional and global clients to understand and address their most complex and visible opportunities and challenges.   As a team, we enable organizations to identify and address their most critical issues, ranging from strategic direction and alignment, digital disruption and digital transformation responses to the accelerating pace of change whether technological, political or societal in nature.   Whilst the nature of our work focuses on the design and facilitation of collaborative events, the competencies required is a diverse and challenging blend of logical problem solving, innovative thinking, political astuteness. Exemplar communication skills, psychology, an open and inquisitive mind and a fundamental desire to enable the capabilities of others to reach resolutions. In terms of skills facilitation is grounded in a number of methodologies of which Design Thinking is core but equally critical are project and program management, change management and a depth of understanding across the entire consulting value chain. While not critical across all sectors a current and relevant level of experience and knowledge of client and industry issues is crucial.   It is expected that EY Wavespace Consultants will confidently engage and influence diverse groups of senior project participants who are operating under high pressure and create the environment and framework that empowers them to rapidly understand challenges, identify options for potential resolution and to steer them towards an appropriate set of action oriented outcomes.
job_req: Your key responsibilities   As an EY Wavespace Consultant, you will own the design, build and delivery of large scale, high production facilitated workshops for our client’s business transformation needs. In this role, you should be able to deliver quality client service, analyse complex problems and deliver insightful solutions. You will also be expected to have excellent communication skills, integrate into new teams and rapidly establish relationships.   More specifically, the successful candidate should:  Bring a unique set of skills to bear on the challenges facing our clients (industry trends, critical issues and concerns of board level executives, an understanding of the challenges faced within at least one of our target sectors, the ability to translate complex issues ranging from strategic, digital, customer, compliance, into coherent problem statements and the ability to design processes to enable organizations to resolve complex issues.. Demonstrate rounded understanding of our capabilities (Organisational Change Management, Organisational Design, Digital transformation, customer experience, large scale transformation, technology enablement, process efficiency) and take a practical/business driven approach to solving complex client challenges within those focus areas Be up to date with key technology, consumer and industry trends Be able to influence and persuade stakeholders to gain support for workshop design decisions that help teams take a practical approach to solving issues and gaining client agreement Encourage and facilitate collaboration amongst team members, and promote an inclusive working environment Be able to identify and help manage any potential issues and risks during a client engagement Contribute to business development and client pursuit activities, by preparing proposals, presentations for potential clients and thought leadership brochures Identify and flag any follow-on engagement opportunities Support and lead certain engagement activities from planning through to implementation Develop the capabilities of the broader organization to encompass leading practices and innovative ways of working    Skills and attributes for success     Understanding the toolkit for collaborative, design-led workshops that meet the needs of our clients’ reality and challenges (and on many occasions supporting the client in specifying their challenge)   Development of a session design to support the client in:   Better understanding their challenge through a broadening of their exposure to aligned market trends, case studies, examples and leading practices   Supporting the client in bringing to bear an awareness of options that will drive significant change in relation to the challenge   Creating tactical and practical steps for resolution   Supporting the alignment of groups through collaborative activity in co-developing solutions   Generating momentum and a sense of engagement and excitement around the proposed solutions     Managing the delivery of sessions ranging from 10 to 150 participants, ensuring a high quality seamless experience for all participants, an inclusive process that engages all, an action oriented event that maintains pace and a focus on outcomes that are both practical and short term.   Continuously focusing on process improvement, innovation and quality of events and the experience of customers   A depth of understanding and inquisitiveness to support the digital enablement of the collaborative experience and development of a truly connected collaboration offering   The ability to plan and manage multiple complex and critical projects across multiple locations under scrutiny of executive level internal and external customers   To qualify for the role you must have demonstrable understanding and/or experience in:    Organisational Change Management or other large scale transformation programs Project Management Large scale meeting management and facilitation Digital transformation Cultural/political awareness Deep personal EQ strength    Ideally, you’ll also have:  Working knowledge of Design Thinking and Customer Experience An advanced degree in a related field  What we look for   Aside from the world-class messaging we deliver to leading companies, what makes us unique is our fun, transparent, highly entrepreneurial and collaborative culture. We work hard, play hard and love what we do together. Day in and day out, we know we can count on one another. If you think everything we’ve said so far sounds great, then we look forward to hearing from you! What working at EY offers    We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, CPF, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you  About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world.    Apply now.

job_desc: Team Introduction Launched in 2012, Lazada Group has grown rapidly to include over 4.900 full-time employees in the region, with eCommerce operations in Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and a sourcing center in China that drives cross-border marketplace activities, Lazada helps more than 80,000 local and international sellers as well as 2,500 brands serve the 560 million consumers in the region through its marketplace platform, supported by a wide range of tailored marketing, data, and service solutions. Lazada offers an excellent customer experience through a wide network of logistics partners and its own first- and last-mile delivery arm.  Revolutionizing the way customers shop in Southeast Asia and perform online transactions across the region, Lazada has reached an online footprint of approximately 6 million unique daily visits to its websites, and the largest Facebook community in Southeast Asia with over 16.5 million fans.  Lazada Group owns the biggest and the most efficient technology driven logistics and fulfilment ecosystem in the region – Lazada eLogistics. With 11 own warehouses, 5 sorting centers, 78 last-mile hubs we are ensuring 48 hours delivery of more than 6 million orders every month. Our warehouses cover more than 115 thousands of square miles and it takes less than 2 hours to process every order even during massive sales campaigns. Having our own cross-border operator helps us connect more than 100 million of customers and businesses from all over Asia. Our transportation is driven by our own Lazada Express delivery fleet which, together with more than 80 third-party logistics, guarantees high quality 48 hours delivery. All of that would be impossible without sophisticated IT systems, which are being developed and expanded in-house by one of the most experienced and agile tech teams in Southeast Asia! The Role  Work closely with data scientists to productionize machine learning models and build highly scalable APIs Build or customize machine learning models to suit the project requirements Build data pipelines using big data tools to ensure timely data delivery for your projects Collaborate with team members to build reusable components and improve software engineering practises in the team
job_req: Bachelor's or Master's degree preferably in computer science or related field Understanding of machine learning algorithms, deep learning and big data processing tools Exposure to big data tools like Hive, Spark, Map Reduce Proven work experience delivering software projects preferably server side or backend development Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms, concepts like concurrency, no-sql databases etc. 2+ years of experience in Java. Good understanding of Python and SQL Understanding of object oriented programming and design concepts
comp: LAZADA SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.

job_desc: COMPANY DESCRIPTION  NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The rapid adoption of technology and mobile devices have contributed to vast newflows of information which are larger in volume, faster in velocity, diverse in variety,and requires veracity of the information for use. This new type of information—broadly known as big data (and combined with tools and data platforms)—if utilised well, could radically improve business performance. As the organization embarks to become a data led group, significant decisions andvalue generation will be based on the data that we capture and deploy. The leaders of the Social Enterprises are keen to utilize the data to drive growth, deliver customer service, and create personalized experiences. The role of VP, Enterprise Data Warehouse will drive the overall strategy andexecution of how this data will be captured, stored, accessed, and deployed across these social enterprises. The role will devise a consistent data warehouse architecture strategy and a comprehensive framework for a single or hybrid datamanagement platform build on AWS, evaluate and deploy tools to access this data, deploy BI tools, set up data governance and transfer frameworks and protocols, and manage the inflow and outflow of this information. In addition, this role will work with all API developers to ensure our data flows are consistent, follow data privacy guidelines, and protects our information sharing procedures. NTUC group has 9 social enterprises and this leader will develop the enterprise data warehouse strategy, execution, and maintenance across ALL these enterprises withina central group analytics office capability. The group leader will have the following core responsibilities:  A complete enterprise DWH strategy and data architecture for all the 9 SE’s. The platform is already on AWS. ETL and data engineers to build, transfer, and maintain data into this platform. Data governance and data quality expert to build all governance and access principles. Business Analysts to act as strategic partners to each SE CTO’s.  The Role: As we embark on the journey of Data led enterprise, the role will be a combination of Data architecture, Data Management, Data Governance, and data visualization. The responsibilities will be as follows:  Define and set the standards for an enterprise wide framework for DWH management (on Amazon cloud), data governance, and utilization ofinformation as an organizational asset. Develop an overall data capture, storage, and dissemination framework for all the social enterprises defining central vs. local data framework. Build the ETL frameworks for each SE working with their technology and data leaders and enable a consistent data model for each of the enterprises inthe group CAO platform. Set data governance standards, data control processes, data policy standards, and effective usage frameworks for the enterprise and all the SE’s. Work with software vendors to deploy the latest BI, analytical and big data tools across the franchise. Lead the efforts with our digital platform managers to ensure our data flows and API’s have defined and consistent frameworks. Work with our customer experience teams, data science groups, and product managers to deploy tools and enable information access capabilities. Closely partner with our data product solutions team as we build NE into an insights driven platform. Work closely with SE CTO’s to deploy data towards payments, authentication, and insight solutions.
job_req: Must be highly technical/strong hardware and software engineering competencies. Focus will be on cloud based DWH architecture, latest DWH technologies, and CLOUD capabilities. Demonstrated experience of moving data from existing platforms to CLOUD architecture. Worked closely with BI teams, data science teams, and product teams to deploy the latest software including capable experience with latest tools like HADOOP, SPARK, HANA, TABLEAU, and other latest data tools. Must have worked on new e-biz enabled business models and how data is architected in these areas specially payments, authentication, and insights/search. Managed and rolled-out data governance standards, data protocols, data security, and privacy disciplines. Worked closely with business and data science partners, product vendors, and software firms. Managed significant budgets and put budgeting plans and financial disciplines in previous experiences. Critical to have strong presentation skills, communication and articulation to non-data partners essential. Strong strategic capability that has been proven by having built large data platforms for enterprises, e-commerce, and other digital ecosystems.

job_desc: Demonstrate and communicate a passion for building the data foundation, products and capabilities that drive business growth · Create data segmentation and modelling · Build innovative data products (e.g., Artificial Intelligence, real-time services, such as personalisation and commerce graphing using Big Data platforms with real-time data ingestion and processing) · Execute descriptive analyses, ranging from identifying product opportunities to understanding user behaviour
job_req: Techniques like: Statistics based Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Graph Theory · Cloud Architecture background · One or more programming languages like Python, Java, R, or Scala · Delivering data science components that are part of successful commercial products · Collaborating with engineering teams to develop prototypes and software products that can be deployed across varied environments (e.g.: cloud, on-premises, devices, etc.) · Big Data and Fast Data (i.e.: real time streaming)

job_desc: The National University of Singapore is recruiting a Deputy Director for the Lloyd’s Register Foundation Institute for the Public Understanding of Risk (LRFIPUR), National University of Singapore (NUS). Founded in 1905, NUS is consistently ranked among the world’s top 30 universities and Asia’s top 2 universities. It is an innovative, research-intensive university with over 36,000 students from 100 countries.    Background Established in 2016, LRFIPUR is the first of its kind in Asia and aspires to become a world leading centre of excellence that will inspire the public understanding of risk in Asia and globally. The Institute will undertake independent research and education, building connections with practical end-users such as policy makers, decision makers and opinion formers in governments, industry sectors, regulators, the media and the general public. It will be multi-disciplinary, spanning engineering, statistics, sociology, and psychology, including the application of big-data analytics to on-line data sources to better understand public attitudes and anxieties around everyday risks.   This Institute aims be a magnet attracting top international risk-related experts for cross-learning and collaboration that will develop into a renowned global institution for global risk understanding. The direction, priorities and output of the Institute will be independent in order to earn public credibility. It will also provide objective commentary on hot topics surrounding the popular understanding of risk. The Institute will generate new understanding and develop new tools and approaches applied to enhancing the public understanding of risk and promoting communication between all stakeholders in society.
job_req: The Institute seeks to hire a world-renowned scholar or industry expert in a relevant field to be its Deputy Director. Successful applicants should have proven experience and a strong track record in running similar-sized international, multidisciplinary programmes on the scale intended for the Institute. The appointment of Deputy Director is a full-time position with generous support for research and outreach activities.   The Deputy Director will support the Director and be part of the Institute’s management board, which works in consultation with the Institute’s Governing Board to provide leadership in research, education and outreach. He or she should be a visionary and energetic leader who is capable of building international connections.    Interested candidates are encouraged to find out more at http://lrfi.nus.edu.sg

Can you wear many hats?  YOU AGAIN:  Graduated from an Engineering School, you have a proven experience of 2 to 10 years on a  similar position. On these occasions, you will  carry out code, performance and security audits as well as architecture studies.  ➔ Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code  ➔ Ensuring high performance and responsiveness to any technical requests  ➔ You are familiar with Agile / Scrum Methodologies and will be part of daily stand up,  backlog management, demos, retros, etc.  ➔ Ensuring not only development but also testing, maintainance, and support  STILL YOU:  ✔ You have at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience in Front-end development (AngularJS, ReactJS etc) and Back end (NodeJS, Java, Python, Clojure, Databases, PHP, etc.), or mobile (Swift for IOS, Android, native or hybrid) development.  ✔ You are interested in designing scalable, reliable and secure softwares using a  combination of different languages, frameworks, libraries and technical environment.  ✔ You like to work in all phases of a rapid product development lifecycle: You are familiar  with Agile Methodologies, Scrum, Kanban, and interested in learning more about Design  Thinking, Lean Start-up, TDD, BDD, or XP.  ✔ You are communicative with good sense of idealism and pragmatism.  ✔ You’re endlessly curious and thrive in an environment where you’re continually  learning and solving new problems. PALO IT is a learning company guided by the values of Agility and craftsmanship offering you multiple possibilities to express yourself and enhance your skills through :  # Our monthly BarCamps; # Our R&D projects; # Our Practices (Development, Architecture, Lean & Agile, Big Data); # Our missions high added value missions in France and internationally that will make you discover new horizons; # Our participation to and sponsoring of major technical events; # And our parties parties = FUN !  Firmly focusing on international expansion, we have offices in France, Hong Kong, Singapore, Sydney and Mexico, meet us to continue this growth !  If you like what you just read, we’d love to have a chat with you!
job_req: ✔ You have at least 1 to 2 years of hands-on experience in ReactJS and other Front-end development (Javascript, VueJS, MeteorJS, Clojurescript, AngularJS, etc) and Back end (NodeJS, Java, Python, Clojure, Databases, etc.), or mobile (Swift for IOS, Android, native or hybrid) development. ✔     You are passionate about new technologies and digital innovation. ✔     Experience in building and delivering web / mobile business solutions (e.g. in Banking, Travel, Finance, Healthcare, Information industries) and Restful API projects. ✔     Has a very good knowledge with deploying and maintaining a database (MongoDB, Postgres, Redis, Cassandra) and implementing software in at least one of these programming languages: python, javascript(node.js), java, C#, perl, ruby. Some experience with orchestration and configuration tools such as Rancher, Kubernetes, Swarm, Ansible, and Chef will be a plus. ✔     Practical knowledge and experience with Unified Modeling Language (UML) for business modeling (work flows) and object modelling. ✔     Proven/previous experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment and DevOps. ✔     Strong critical thinker with problem solving aptitude. ✔     Ability to communicate effectively in written documents and oral presentations, explaining concepts clearly to audiences at various levels of technical knowledge. ✔     General banking knowledge or Banking knowledge related to Wealth Management / Private banking is a plus. ✔     You have already worked in an Agile environment driven by Time-To-Market, you have good communication skills, are independent and able to make significant proposals. But most of all, you love CODING! Share your GitHub account!

job_desc: Hewlett Packard Enterprise is one of the world’s iconic tech companies, creating new possibilities for technology to have a meaningful impact on people, businesses, governments, and society.  We provide solutions which enable companies to mobilize their business; mine all their data for insights, on an open, agile cloud; all this securely. We aim at making the complex, simple. Bridging the old and the new. And we do that by harnessing big data, security, mobility, and cloud. We are the only company with the breadth and depth of innovative products and services to provide complete end-to-end solutions in big data, cloud, mobility, and security, not just a disparate set of IT components.  We focus on delivering speed, simplicity, efficiency, and agility so that customers can realize their preferred business outcomes across architectures and in ways that suit their engineering requirements and budgets And this is who we are and why HPE exists – to enable enterprises to accelerate innovation and time to value with the new apps and data, as well as to help you to optimize your current environments by: 1. Making hybrid IT simple – to power your right mix to accelerate innovations for your unique enterprise 2. Powering the Intelligent Edge – to create the next gen of digital experiences and services 3. Providing the expertise to make it happen – to advise, integration and accelerate the outcomes for your enterprise   Job Description :   This role is a newly created position that extends HPE’s customer engagement on IT efficiency and sustainability to the Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) region. HPE’s sustainability leadership provides a point of differentiation with customers, governments, and thought-leaders. This role serves as the overall IT efficiency and sustainability engagement contact for numerous, large named accounts, as well as smaller and indirect accounts. By understanding a client’s key business and IT challenges and requirements, opportunities to leverage IT efficiency best practices, sustainability initiatives, and HPE’s portfolio of products and solutions can be identified. In partnership with the account sales teams, customer consultations are conducted which are focused on driving business (and enhanced sustainability) value for the client.  As a new role, effective relationships will be established with Enterprise Account Executives (EAE), regional sales, and channel sales and marketing teams.   Responsibilities:  Implement strategic relationships with senior HPE leaders in all routes to market within the APJ region to drive opportunities to leverage IT efficiency and sustainability leadership In partnership with sales teams, identify customer opportunities to deliver IT efficiency and sustainability briefings, best practice sharing, and consultations Leverage customer network to identify opportunities for collaboration, thought-leadership, and joint go-to-market events Partner with Customer Briefing Center staff to serve as their primary resource for reactive and proactive customer briefings on IT efficiency and sustainability topics Establish a professional working relationship (up to the executive level) with clients and develop a core understanding of the client’s unique business needs Effectively communicate with customers, stakeholders, sales teams, and partners, translating sustainability and IT efficiency principles to language appropriate to the audience Track all engagements and develop appropriate metrics which yield appropriate business insights
job_req: Education and Experience Required:  Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in science, engineering or environmental sciences – Post graduate degree preferred Strong experience in sustainability and/or IT efficiency topics Experience delivering innovate solutions to challenging problems 3-5 years’ experience in business development, sales, global program development, engineering sales support or customer engagement Experience collaborating as part of a diverse, distributed team    Knowledge and Skills:  Working knowledge of ICT products, services, and solutions with efficiency benefits Entrepreneurial mindset and willingness to develop technology practice in a new region Broad understanding of the intersection between technology and sustainability and ability to innovate to meet customer's needs by applying standard as well as creative solutions to meet those needs Openness to diverse opinions and willingness to collaborate on multidisciplinary programs Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with all organizational levels Ability to understand the customer's business and technology challenges and develop meaningful solutions

You have knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases. And a minimum of skills on ETL, so do not hesitate and join us. job_desc: About Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R)  The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualisation solutions. For more information about I²R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg The candidate is required to perform the following tasks:  Develop of semi-supervised or unsupervised method for machine translation or language understanding Integration of knowledge and language understanding into the NMT Framework
job_req: Minimum Bachelor in Computer Science, specialise in Computational Linguistics Entry level graduates with relevant experience in machine translation, natural language processing, machine learning theory and practice are welcome to apply Adept in C/C++ programming or Python programming Ability to work independently as well as a good team player  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. job_desc: AspenTech is a leading supplier of software that optimizes process manufacturing – including oil and gas, petroleum, chemicals, pharmaceuticals and other industries that manufacture and produce products from a chemical process. With integrated aspenONE solutions, process manufacturers can implement best practices for optimizing their engineering, manufacturing and supply chain operations. As a result, AspenTech customers are better able to increase capacity, improve margins, reduce costs and become more energy efficient. In addition, the launch of the Asset Performance Management (APM) suite supports corporate reliability initiatives, taking an analytics-driven approach to asset availability. It combines deep process modeling expertise with real time big data to extend asset life and effectiveness. APM enables you to accurately predict and eliminate the root cause of all failures, so the only downtime you experience is the downtime you plan. We are looking to hire a Senior Principal Business Consultant with technical strength in Asset Performance Management for our Team in Singapore. The business consulting team is tasked with supporting the sales process with knowledge of the AspenTech products and services, value definition and industry vertical knowledge as well as developing and maintaining key relationships with AspenTech's clients and prospects. The candidate will be responsible for working with our account managers and the technical community within our clients. The successful candidate must have strong business acumen and customer interaction skills. The role requires the ability to understand customer challenges and industry drivers, formulate potential solutions from Aspen's portfolio, build and justify the business case for client investment, and provide support to the direct sales force in the sales process. The candidate will be measured against the license revenue and service bookings objectives established by management for the relevant vertical.  Apply consultative skills in customer-facing situations to identify customer problems and understand their business and operational issues. Facilitate customer understanding of APM suites/solutions technical functionality, value creation and business process improvement. Articulate the overall solution and provide the vision with an understanding of the customer's business and technology needs, AspenTech's previous successes and the competitive landscape. Act as business partner with the account team to develop the account strategy based on the industry and client business environment maximizing product usage and growth. Refine the solution and vision messages for the overall project and work with other team members to develop presentation materials that effectively communicate these messages, leading clients to action. Participate and/or lead customer consulting engagements to facilitate sales, including demonstrations, workshops, value assessments, and technical seminars. Proactively support pipeline development (e.g. account planning, awareness sessions, etc) and sales execution for assigned accounts and opportunities. Develop commercial proposals for assigned opportunities. Respond to RFI/RFQ/RFP questionnaires as required. Accountable for achieving personal targets such as productivity, bookings and other Business Consulting related targets. Challenge customer’s current way of doing business to drive results.
job_req: B.S. in Engineering with 10-15 years practical experience in consulting, technology, and/or industry. Minimum of 8-10 years’ experience in APM related technologies. Expertise in Process Industry is preferred. Experience in the manufacturing plant is required. Ability to lead cross functional teams and manage multiple priorities under pressure. Strong business acumen. Adept at performing customer interviews, identifying improvement opportunities, and overcoming resistance to change. Ability to assess and articulate customer value creation. Must possess a strong passion for cutting-edge technologies, with the aptitude and desire to learn new skills. A team player with the ability to relate to customers and maintain good working relationship. Strong communication skills both written and verbal. Flexibility to travel at least 50% of time. Specific Product Knowledge:    Experience with batch processing and the regulated industries would be a plus, but is not required. Industry experience preferred. Chemical and/or refining industry experience strongly preferred. Strong knowledge of Chemical production and engineering business processes. Knowledge of asset management and maintenance business processes.     PLEASE NOTE:  This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of the work to be performed by any person employed in this role.  This job description is not intended to be a specific or exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required.  Aspen Technology reserves the right in its sole discretion to add to, reduce from, or make changes to this job description, and/or to the actual duties performed by the employee, as necessary to meet business and organizational needs. Aspen Technology is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer.

Collaborative and  build strong relationships and trust across a very diverse cultural environment of customers and employees.  Also demonstrate the personal flexibility to adapt and contribute new innovative thinking. A Regional ambassador in Corporate.   Aspen Technology is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer.

job_desc: We are looking for highly motivated Research Fellow with strong research interests at the junction of mobility, urban sensing, transportations, and big data analytics. We have been depending our understanding of mobility from the urban data and are making use of such understanding to develop intelligent methods and systems to improve state-of-the-art practices of urban systems and applications.
