job_desc: Wilmar International Limited has recently established a world-class research center jointly with National University of Singapore (WIL@NUS) to solve industrial problems using R&D as a platform. We are looking to expand our team to explore the application of data analytics and machine learning in agribusiness and quality control.   Key responsibilities (not limited to):  Manage and preprocess data Ability to code and script based on specified tasks Simple to intermediate statistical analysis Strong in algorithms Versatile in applying computational techniques to solve open problems Participate in seminars and research-in-progress meetings within the team and collaborators
job_req: Job requirements:  Honours degree in area of Computer Science Ability to code in a few languages - R, python, java, bash Good to have mathematical background Good written and oral communication skills. Team player with initiative and drive

job_desc: Who are we? We are the University of Cambridge presence in Singapore called Cambridge CARES, sponsored by the NRF CREATE program CAM.CREATE. The research programme Cambridge Centre for Carbon Reduction in Chemical Technology (C4T) is a joint Cambridge, NTU and NUS research activity within Cambridge CARES. Our team is comprised of world-class scientists and engineers working in a vibrant, fast-paced environment with great opportunities for knowledge and skills development.   Who are we looking for? We are looking for a talented and creative computer scientist, computer engineer, or computational mathematician to support the C4T research team. Primarily, we are looking for an individual dedicated to physics and chemistry based and data-driven modelling, semantic representation and visualisation of chemical processes and industrial networks of an industrial park. You will  build data models; visualize data in a modern media lab; develop software systems; perform data integration; participate in research discussions with local industries and partners, and overseas universities.  The project aims to develop new methods and algorithms to support the development of chemical reaction mechanisms. Aspects of particular interest include automatic generation, coupling to first-principles quantum chemistry calculations, and ontological data representation. The successful candidates will be expected to closely collaborate with the Cambridge CARES research centre sponsored by the NRF CREATE program in Singapore. The methods resulting from this project will need to be seamlessly integrated into an existing comprehensive virtual simulation platform which is currently being developed as part of CARES, using ideas from Industry 4.0, Internet of Things, the Semantic Web, machine learning, and statistics.
job_req: What skills do you have?  A degree in a relevant discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics or Physics; A least 5 years of relevant experience; Demonstrable experience in software engineering using Java or Python; Willingness and capable to acquire software skills and knowledge about modern technologies; Some understanding of thermodynamics and reaction kinetics, electronic structure theory, relational and non-relational database management systems, semantic web and ontologies (an advantage). Mathematical and statistical skills, with experience in algorithm and methods development (an advantage). Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.    What can we offer you?  A stimulating working-environment with friendly, highly motivated colleagues; A competitive salary in line with your skills and experience; A one-year contract in the first instance, extendable following a satisfactory performance in the first year; Employment under a Research Collaboration Agreement between CARES and Nanyang Technological University (NTU); Comprehensive medical insurance coverage as part of your employment.    Please note this post is based in Singapore.

job_desc: A research associate position on security, formal verification and program analysis is available in the Cyber Security Lab, School of Computer Science and Engineering, Nanyang Technological University. job_desc: A Research Fellow position is available at the Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N), Nanyang Technological University, in the areas of energy storage thermal simulation/analysis with Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning.The position includes but not limited to leading a team of engineers and students in fulfilling the deliverables of the project, conducting research and designing and developing algorithms, models as well as techniques for purposes of prediction and estimation of battery thermal conditions, predictive maintenance and data processing. The candidate would design the thermal distribution model for an MWh level battery energy storage system for smart grid. Candidate must have rich experience in thermal simulation, FEA, machine learning and numeral calculations. The selected candidate is expected to contribute to the project straight away. Knowledge of image processing and time-series data regression would be a plus.

Well-developed skills on battery energy storage systems operating condition monitoring and analysis, e.g., battery safety, health and etc. Knowledge with basic machine learning algorithms, like neural network, SVM, deep learning. Image processing and signal processing analysis using convolutional neural network would be a plus. Independent problem solver with the ability to co-operate and work in a team

job_desc: NUS Business School is recognized as one of the top business schools in the Asia-Pacific region. It also co-hosts the NUS Business Analytics Centre jointly with the NUS School of Computing. Our vision is to be the leading business school in Asia, globally recognised for excellence in education and research, and our mission is to advance knowledge and develop leaders so as to serve business and society. The Department of Analytics & Operations in the National University of Singapore (NUS) Business School is seeking qualified candidates for a Lecturer/Senior Lecturer (Educator Track) position in analytics and operations, starting July 2019. The appointee will be expected to teach both undergraduate and graduate courses such as text analytics, social media analytics, network analytics and general machine learning/AI. Candidates should ideally have a Ph.D. degree in data science, machine learning or a related field, plus teaching experience at university level. Candidates with a Master’s degree and profound industry experience in relevant areas might also be considered. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as a promising career path.
job_req: The NUS Business School has a long tradition of excellence in both teaching and research. We strive to nurture future-ready, open-minded, and professionally competent graduates. The ideal candidate should be a passionate and student-centric educator who can demonstrate a commitment to a teaching career, a practitioner who can relate machine learning theories to business applications, and a coach who will groom our students into business-focused and analytics-driven managers. Candidates who are early career academics should ideally have at least some previous teaching assistant experience, while those more experienced candidates should have previous lecturing experience, evidence of curriculum development and ideally also experience in supervising Master’s students. Qualified applicants should submit a full CV (including a full list of publications and teaching achievements), a cover letter addressing their teaching philosophy, and three letters of reference (or a list of three individuals who can serve as references) to Dr Liu Qizhang (bizlqz@nus.edu.sg), on or before 31st May 2019. Applicants without a publication record should also submit a job market paper.

job_desc: Soft robotics is a growing, new field that focuses on these mechanical qualities and on the integration of materials, structures, and software. In the same way that animal movements are based on the tight integration of skin for protection and sensing, soft robotics aims to achieve better and simpler mechanisms by exploiting the ‘mechanical intelligence’ of soft materials. This job aims to develop intelligent soft robotics with 2D materials protective and sensory skin, and also to build a machine-learning model to enhance the analytic capability of robotics.   The intelligent soft robotics will feature  high mechanical stretchability, effective chemical and flame protection that allows the personnel and robotic to survive or work in a harsh environment, skin-like sensing capacities that can monitor the actuation of pneumatic robotic hands and their interaction with human/environment, and AI neural networks with advanced analytics capabilities.  The machine with sensors can enhance their environmental awareness and improve the robotic-human interaction, which will be effective in overcoming mobility limitations experienced with standard rigid tools.
job_req: A Ph.D. degree in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Material Science, Chemistry, or related fields. The ability to work independently, and adapt to new areas is required as the needs of the project evolve. The candidates with computational background (coding or simulation) will be highly preferred. Experience in 2D materials assembly, stretchable electronics, electrochemical characterizations, and soft robotics would be an advantage. The candidate should have excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as excellent interpersonal skills.   Applicants should email a cover letter and curriculum vitae to Asst. Prof. Po-Yen Chen (checp@nus.edu.sg). The CV should include educational and professional background, a list of publications/posters/conference presentations, and contact information of referees.

job_desc: Our vision is to build a unified Commercial Digital Platform capability (data, people, processes, technology), which will enable us to enable a step change in commercial performance, transform customer experiences, and play a pioneering role in redefining our industry over the long term. Our aim is to deliver the most engaging experiences for our customers, underpinned by digital technologies and new agile ways of working. As part of this work, in partnership with BCG Digital Ventures (part of the Boston Consulting Group), Rio Tinto has built a MVP for a predictive shipping analytics platform using the latest Machine Learning and AI technologies. They are now looking for smart people to join the team and propel the next phase of the product’s development, and support the broader digitalisation transformation across Rio Tinto’s commercial function. We're working with a modern tech stack - ES6, React and Redux, with a Python back end deployed on AWS, and are looking for experienced engineers to join us, working on the design and development of the new product under the direction of the Venture CTO.  What you'll do:  Collaborating with a team of engineers across the venture team to ensure we deliver an empowering user experience Communicating ideas across the cross-functional team in an effective manner Sharing technical solutions and product ideas through design reviews, pair programming, code reviews and discussions Utilising a proactive and responsive approach to problem solving Implementing highly scalable and maintainable frontend services, and working with business specialists and visual designers to design optimal solutions Working with ES6, React (boilerplate), Redux
job_req: What you'll bring:  Sustained experience in professional software development using ES6 and React An appreciation for design, with a focus on building elegant applications that are pleasing to the eye Strong analytical and debugging skills A preference for working with cross-disciplinary teams to introduce and enhance behaviour and test-driven approaches, resulting in clean, elegant code and application architectures Experience of working with team members to encourage the writing of clean, elegant code using test-first approaches A background working in teams using Agile approaches  Tech Stack:  ES6, React, Node, AWS, Serverless
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982

job_desc: The Rapid-Rich Object SEarch (ROSE) Lab is a research initiative of Nanyang Technological University (NTU) aims to create a platform for fast mobile searches on object databases.  The three key thrusts of the ROSE Lab are:  (i) large-scale object database collection and analytics, (ii) scalable mobile object search with contextual mobility, and (iii) media cloud platform.  Resources at the ROSE Lab consist of NTU Faculty, Researchers, PhD Students, and Visiting Scholars & Students from other institutions from around the world. Learn more about ROSE Lab at http://rose.ntu.edu.sg/ Job Description The successful applicant will be responsible for the development of action recognition and computer vision systems using machine learning techniques.  This includes:  Develop action recognition and computer vision systems, including parallelising and optimising the algorithms. Working with industry partners of the ROSE Lab to test the classification systems.
job_req: Master degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or Engineering. Must have research and development experience in Human Activity Analysis, Computer Vision, and Machine Learning. Must be good at C/C++. Must be good at Python. Applicants with experience in deep learning with convolutional and/or recurrent neural networks are highly preferred. Ideally, the applicant should have experience working with large-scale datasets. Applicants with good publication are highly preferred. Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to work with people from varied backgrounds.   We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_desc: Are you the type of engineer who punches juke boxes to make the music start? Do you consider riding your motorcycle off into the a sunset a personal hobby? Is architecting a system from the ground up no big deal to you? We're looking for full-time software engineer to make this happen. The Product We are on a mission to revolutionize Sales industry using data science. Our product helps our customers to collect and enrich their target prospects. Our internal data processing combines human intelligence and data science to enable our customers to find perfect contact information and save to their existing platforms like Salesforce, etc. The Challenge  We are at an exciting stage in our growth. We are getting traction with big customers, scaling out, and solving increasingly complex engineering problems. Our systems are mostly written in Scala. We have used Kafka as backbone to communicate between our API server and micro-services. Smart architecture design is crucial in order to guarantee our micro-services based systems run smoothly and reliably.  We have very complex integrations with 3rd parties systems like Salesforce, Gmail and etc. These integrations are core to what we're offering to our customers. This position will involve the development and deployment of machine learning technology in areas such as email signature extraction, account recommendation, company domain searching, natural language processing etc.  This position will involve collecting training and test data set using DB scripts or Spark scripts. This position will involve writing APIs for clients to utilize your trained models.  The Stack Scala, Python, Keras, Kafka, Spark, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Hyperledger, Docker The Team We want team members with attributes like: - Focus on delivering value to the customer  - Strong belief in collaboration  - Passion that drives you to execute and innovate  - Ability to self-manage and take ownership of a feature  - Ability to juggle many projects and responsibilities - Extremely entrepreneurial and self-driven - Not afraid of a steep learning curve  - Passionate about building a big business that transforms the sales industry - Exceptional at writing scalable, production-ready code - Thrive in a fast-paced environment - Avoid over-engineering  - Simple designs and fast execution  - Discipline in following process and documenting your work These personality traits define the culture we are building and are more important to us than a particular set of technical skills. The Responsibilities If you join LeadIQ, you will learn a lot: In terms of technical ability there are many cool tools, technologies, patterns and other great developers that will sharpen your skills. Personally you be given the chance to step up, lead and make your mark in a growing startup as we tackle the challenges in our next phase of growth. On the technical front, we need you skilled in:  Analyze source data and data flows, working with structured and unstructured data Manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources to highlight patterns, anomalies, relationships and trends Apply AI/Machine Learning technology to solve real-world problems Communicate and present models to customers and product team Coordinating with fellow engineering team to make product features that our customers will love to use At least one functional language. We're using Scala (or experience in e.g. Haskell or Clojure). You'll write Scala code to create APIs to access ML models. Python language. Our ML models are built with open source libraries that mostly use Python. Concurrency (futures, actors, basic understanding of threads).  Basic Qualifications  Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or Physics or related field 2+ years of experience with Machine Learning techniques and tools to include one or more of the following: classification, clustering, regression or neural networks  Preferred Qualifications  1+ years of experience with Spark, Kafka, or Elastic Search 2+ years of experience of functional programming with Scala, Haskell or Clojure Demonstrated ability in the application of Machine Learning/AI in real-world industrial settings with large scale data Experience with Agile software development Strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills and an ability to work in a team environment Comfortable working in an environment where problems are not always well-defined   So if you feel like you're a good fit for us, drop us a line! We love meeting developers who are excited by our product!
job_req: If you join LeadIQ, you will learn a lot: In terms of technical ability there are many cool tools, technologies, patterns and other great developers that will sharpen your skills. Personally you be given the chance to step up, lead and make your mark in a growing startup as we tackle the challenges in our next phase of growth. On the technical front, we need you skilled in:  Analyze source data and data flows, working with structured and unstructured data Manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources to highlight patterns, anomalies, relationships and trends Apply AI/Machine Learning technology to solve real-world problems Communicate and present models to customers and product team Coordinating with fellow engineering team to make product features that our customers will love to use At least one functional language. job_desc: Make a meaningful impact – Make a positive contribution to hospitals and patients through AI. Learn and Master – The opportunity to work with, learn from and share knowledge with uber- smart colleagues in a culture of collaboration and technical excellence. We groom our employees and make sure that they stay at the cutting edge of the technology stack. Attractive remuneration – Competitive pay with share award for top performers. Progression Path – Well-defined tech career progression path. We are willing to groom engineers and fresh graduates who don’t have a background in deep learning but are hungry to learn. You will also have the opportunities to attend top machine learning conferences like NIPS and ICML. Who Will Impress Us A strong technical individual with a geeky background like computer science, physics, mathematics who loves programming, solves tough problems, fascinated by Maths and Physics and wants to learn Artificial Intelligence and build deep learning models. Machine learning background is not a requirement.
job_req: The Candidate Our aim is to align you with the activities which truly interests you, stretches you technically and helps you grow and impact on billions of patients.  Some of the things you will learn: Computer Vision / Image Segmentation, Localisation, Classification Deep Learning Techniques, Research Techniques, Paper Writing Tensor Flow or Theano or Torch Python, C++ or Java Numpy, Pandas, Sklearn, Scipy, Seaborn Building Deep Learning Models like RNN and CNN and Other Neural Network Models  Desired Education Bachelor / Master / PhD in engineering or computer science or mathematics or physics

job_desc: Associate Professor Krishna Savani at Nanyang Business School, Singapore, is recruiting a Project Officer to conduct machine learning and deep learning neural network analyses on social science and business data. The primary responsibilities would be:  Identifying the most appropriate deep learning model to run for various types of data (both for imputation and for prediction) Running the model Reporting results in the desired format Comparing the results of deep learning models with the results of traditional linear statistical models and with non-deep learning AI models.
job_req: Bachelor’s degree in engineering with coursework in deep learning and statistics / econometrics. Past experience developing deep learning models in Python or R.

job_desc: The Offer  Opportunity to lead and support the execution of interdisciplinary research and development programs Attractive salary & benefits    The Employer Our client is Asia’s leading media organisation, engaging minds and enriching lives across multiple languages and platforms. The company's core business is publishing of newspapers, magazines and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns other digital products, online classifieds, radio stations and outdoor media.   The Job The ATL Department focuses on the development of software, algorithms in AI, machine learning, immersive tech, analytics to provide advanced capabilities across multiple business division utilizing state of the art technologies.   As the ATL Head, you are expected to develop, lead, and support the execution of interdisciplinary research and development programs utilizing advanced machine learning, immersive technologies, media tech. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  Forming partnerships and collaboration with academia and industry leaders Preparation and execution of department budgets, strategic planning, and staff and resource development and utilization.  This position may be filled by either a Research Faculty or Research and Development Engineer.
job_req: The Profile  You possess a Masters degree in Computer Science and Engineering with 10 years of experience. You must have a strong Systems Engineering background with a working knowledge across media technology, deep learning, algorithms. Experience in rapid prototyping of software systems is highly desired. You demonstrated a track record of interdisciplinary research and development leading to successful technology transition. You have the ability to network and collaborate with University, faculty, startups and industry leaders who are engaged in this area. You enjoy finding creative solutions to problems. You have excellent presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, and are adept at leading and working with multiple stakeholders to drive desired outcomes. You are willing to undertake more than 60% of travel.    Apply for this role at https://snaphunt.com/jobs/66088064

job_desc: Our centre is developing human-centred computing systems and solutions to help address some of the key challenges related to aging. As a Research Engineer, you will engage and work with a research team to focus on data analytics on heterogeneous sensory data, e.g., unobtrusive activity recognitions in smart home settings. Our hardware systems collect data from heterogeneous sensing modules which communicate through Wi-Fi, ZigBee and/or Bluetooth with a mix of standards and protocols (CAN, SPI, I2C, and other serial protocols).  Key Responsibilities:  Work closely with both hardware engineers and other researchers to design and develop machine learning models for data analytics Deploy the developed models in real-world settings for longitudinal studies, facilitate in system maintenance and data collection Redesign and redevelop the machine learning models based on intermediate evaluation results
job_req: Bachelor’s degree in Computer/Electrical Engineering or other related fields from top universities.  At least 3 years’ relevant research and development experience  Strong academic record in data analytics related courses Research experience in goal-oriented modelling is required Proficient in Python, C/C++, java or other programming languages Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills

job_desc: We are actively growing our team due to successful launch of our products. From designing user interface to working on novel image processing techniques, there will be lots of research and development required, and ample learning opportunities for all of us to grow together. We are now hiring candidates with experience of interest in any of the following:   (a)   Application development and hardware/software integration (b)   Image processing (c)   Machine learning   Ideally,   -       You love to participate in exploratory, engaging and exciting discussions with customers to design breath-taking software solutions -       Like to get  your hands dirty designing and building innovative solutions that meet real-life application problems -       Enthusiastic and driven to investigate, analyse and integrate new technologies -       Approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you’re building -       Able to see the big picture, understanding how the code you write interacts with systems and services, both internally and externally
job_req: Job Requirements:   -       Diploma or Degree in Computer Science / Computer Studies / Engineering or equivalent, or if you have relevant experience in building all kinds of software applications -       Good knowledge in programming languages like C/C++/C#, Python or Java etc. -       Knowledge in web-server application development in Linux/PC environment, web programming (JavaScript, PHP, HTML, SQL etc) -       Some knowledge in mobile application development -       Strong analytical and problem-solving skills -       Able to articulate/show your portfolio of applications built -       Passion for problem-solving, exploring and learning new languages and drive to churn out solutions

job_desc: DataRobot changes the way users build and deploy highly accurate machine learning models. What does it take to develop the highest quality data science product on the market?  A hybrid testing strategy that combines humans and automation and gets best of both worlds. Our QA Philosophy at DataRobot is one of Quality “Assistance” rather than assurance; as a result, our lean team focuses on empowering every engineering team to own the quality of their code and ensure adequate test coverage for new features. As a member of the Quality Squad, you will:  Test new features for upcoming releases. Help write test plans, test reports, and provide suggestion for improving the QA processes. Perform exploratory testing, communicate with product and development teams to develop a strong understanding of the project and product testing objectives. Manage directives for third-party manual regression testing. Review test coverage of the upcoming features and provide suggestions to improve the quality of the test. Review results of automated tests. Be an active member of the team, suggesting improvements of the processes to increase the quality of the product and performance of the team Successful candidates will be passionate about exploratory testing and test automation, initiative-driven, and self-directed.
job_req: 3+ years of professional quality assurance and testing experience with web applications Good knowledge of testing theory, especially of exploratory testing methods Experience with REST API testing Experience with testing different databases (PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL, etc) Experience with test management tools, (TestRail), automation servers (Jenkins), version control software (GitHub, Bitbucket), and Linux and/or Mac OS X Good English skills Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent   Recommended:  Test automation experience: Protractor/NodeJS/Javascript/Python Jenkins/Docker/AWS expertise Data science experience with computational metrics Technical writing experience

job_desc: COMPANY DESCRIPTION  Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The EDGE: EdTech Greenhouse, under the ambit of SMU’s Centre for Teaching Excellence, is an exciting educational technology set-up which aims to translate high potential research projects (e.g. Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, learning analytics etc.) into minimum viable products for potential campus-wide distribution, bringing about the synthesis of design and development to enhance student learning outcomes. As part of the dynamic EDGE team, the Project Manager, Systems Integration, is required to identify and explore the complex technical and business issues involved in integrating custom software, hardware solutions, commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software and business procedures and services. This would require the clear analysis of existing research prototypes and user requirements for translation to deployment to the university. The project manager’s role is to manage projects of increasing scale, complexity, and risk and to make sure that all of the components come together to ensure that the projects are completed on time and within budget. He/she will work closely with faculty researchers, software developers and the SMU’s Integrated Information Technology Services to understand user requirements, define and deliver new features, test new concepts, and assist with IT Systems integration and final implementation. Job Description  Explore product concepts to find and propose promising directions that address both human and business needs. Study existing system architecture and propose strategic decisions based on associated rationales about the overall structure, including the mapping of human interaction with these components. Gather data to analyse and specify the requirements of a system as part of the IT Systems Analysis and Design process. Supervise and support the coding and development process of software prototypes and minimum viable products. Collaborate closely with software developer(s) and researchers. Project management and support multiple projects simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines. Advise front-end engineers on User Interface (UI) implementation best practices.
job_req: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering. 3 to 5 years of professional experience in project management and application of project management methodologies. Experience in managing cross-functional projects. Ability to write codes to develop proof of concept/minimum viable product systems. Project Management Professional (PMP) is not required, but would be advantageous. Ability to build relationships with and influence other functional areas. Ability to apply Agile and Design Thinking/user-centric methodology to understand user requirements. Experience in the supervision of the coding and development of software prototypes. Knowledge in common database manipulation language, e.g. Structured Query Language (SQL) and applications programming. Experience in machine learning methods and algorithm would be advantageous. Strong interpersonal skills. Highly developed verbal and written communication skills. Experience in managing cross-functional projects. Organization and time management skills. Problem-solving skills with ability to perform root cause analysis. Ability to manage several concurrent projects. Knowledge of the development project lifecycle (e.g., design, development, testing, implementation, etc.) Extensive experience in meeting planning, facilitation, and presentation.  OTHER INFORMATION Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.

job_desc: A Research Associate position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. Job Description Recent studies have found that deep models can be easily fooled by adversarial examples, which poses a big challenge for those safety-critical applications like autonomous vehicles. The position is open for those who are interested in deep learning and computer vision. The successful candidate should be familiar with object detection or semantic segmentation algorithm which will be used as our attack and defensive objective. Then the candidate will be responsible for further research in the adversarial machine learning field to realize the attack and perturbation resistant techniques. The successful candidate is expected to contribute in the research comprises the following topics: (1) Enhance the attacks on open-source object detection model; (2) Evaluate and enhance defenses against adversarial examples; (3) Develop robustness evaluation and fooling recovery solutions on deep learning systems. Apart from working on technical aspects of research projects, the Research Associate will also take charge of general matters for the project, including data management and project documentation, writing project updates, and doing product demonstrations and presentations.
job_req: Master in Engineering, preferably in control engineering, electrical engineering, computer science and technology, mechanical engineering, or information security; Good experience in machine learning and deep learning basics; Good knowledge in optimization (or Game theory), reinforcement learning is a plus.  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_desc: About Tookitaki We are a machine learning powered advanced forecasting platform, focussed on compliance and operational risk management space. Our primary clients are banks, financial institutions and insurance companies. We are bringing a paradigm shift in the approach of risk forecasting, by helping BFSI sector move from static rules engine to dynamically adaptive platform. The key highlights are - ability to choose from multiple non-linear models, improve model performance over time through self-learning technique and deploy models in production faster via pre-packaged distributed environment. Engineering @ Tookitaki The engineering team is responsible for building a robust forecasting platform, which can add significant value to BFSI vertical in solving operational and compliance risk problems. We take pride in building the system right and continuously evolving it. We thrive by customer’s success and successful delivery of the projects has always been our top priority.
job_req: Our Ideal Candidate We are looking for a tech delivery manager to join the engineering team. An ideal person would be someone with significant tech experience in the areas of Big Data engineering (Spark, HDFS, Hive) and large scale DevOps, who would like to take more of a tech managerial role. Your responsibilities would be the successful execution of the product deliverables to our clients.   You are obsessed by the client’s success and prioritize timely delivery over everything else.   You have experience in the Big Data ecosystem - Spark, HDFS, and Hive.   You have some experience contributing to product development.   You have experience with large scale DevOps with hands on experience in configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, Puppet etc.   You have understanding of the overall design and architecture of the product running in the production environment   You have the ability to understand the enterprise architectures and propose an integration plan.

Strong candidates will be enthusiastic, dedicated and focused on strategic development and delivery of Machine Learning external educational offerings. The candidate must have experience executing similar programs and will be a highly motivated professional with demonstrated organizational and communication skills.  Additionally, the candidate must be able to grow positive working relationships with partners and colleagues. Lastly, the candidate will be dedicated and focused on providing top-quality and flawless coordination and seamless delivery of local initiatives and programs. In this role, they will develop positive working relationships with cross-functional teams and ensure that the delivery of our programs externally is focused and impactful for developer and student communities.    Manage program timelines and coordination flawlessly Interface with other departments as necessary to push programs forward, maintain relationships and leverage cross-functional work Manage in-country communications for specific program launches Manage program outreach initiatives: activities focused on increasing awareness, usage and adoption of our ML educational offerings for students and tech industry Manage scheduling, coordination and communication of in-country ML related events in multiple locations Support localization efforts as needed Be confident with program management automation (Apps Script, complex spreadsheet formulas, etc) Be flexible and find innovative ways to problem solve as needed Evaluate data to make decisions and recommendations to further improve the program Escalate issues to more senior program managers and the team as needed Be flexible in working hours to adapt to work happening across different office locations

job_desc:
Role Purpose 
We are looking for a leader who is interested in using data to draw insights that will result in business processes optimisation, benefiting the public. The applicant will be leading a team to plan and design friendly and intuitive survey questionnaires, development of data definitions as well as defining the most appropriate sample methods for households and establishment surveys. The applicant will provide advisory on the data and statistical techniques that are suitable for the purpose of research as well as spotting erroneous interpretation or weakness in data analysis, and to study on different operation aspects to identify opportunities for improvements and productivity gains.
Responsibilities

Lead design, plan and manage the entire survey questionnaires and sampling selection for large-scale national surveys.
Develop definitions for data items, train and guide staff on statistical coding and classification
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs/pain points, scope the problem and develop business case on how to generate useful/effective insights that will help to streamline operations or developing effective solution for citizens
Lead a team to chart and drive the data analytics strategy and build relevant models to conduct meaningful analysis

Requirements

Preferably 8 – 10 years of relevant experience in research and operations
Preferably 5 years of relevant experience in understanding key concepts, techniques and considerations in machine learning and data analytics
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong analytical and critical-thinking skills
Strong business acumen
Proficient in statistical programming tools such as R, SAS, and database querying language such as SQL
Experience in leading a team and ability to work under pressure and tight timelines

Role Purpose
We are looking for an energetic and passionate individual who is interested in using data to help in design solutions that address its business and operational problems, and stay close to the needs of the general public. The applicant will be leading the team to design, plan, co-ordinate and manage large scale national surveys, including the development of data definitions, sample designs for households and establishment survey. The team will also provide advisory on the data and statistical techniques that are suitable for the purpose of research as well as spotting erroneous interpretation or weakness in data analysis, and to study on different operation aspects to identify opportunities for improvements and productivity gains.
Responsibilities

Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs/pain points, scope the problem and develop business case on how to generate useful/effective insights that will help to streamline operations or developing effective solution for citizens
Enhance operational technological processes to keep pace with today fast-changing environment
Lead a team to chart and drive the data analytics strategy and build relevant models to conduct meaningful analysis
Develop definitions for data items, train and guide staff on statistical coding and classification
Drive collection of new data and refinement of existing data sources, including steps to enhance quality of information recorded

Requirements

Preferably 3 – 5 years of relevant experience in research and operations
Preferably 3 years of relevant experience in understanding key concepts, techniques and considerations in machine learning and data analytics
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong analytical and critical-thinking skills
Ability to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges
Proficient in statistical programming tools such as R, SAS, Python, and database querying language such as SQL
Experience in leading a team and ability to work under pressure and tight timelines

Crown Robotics is seeking a Robotics / automation trained engineer to develop next generation F&B automation solutions. Candidate will be working closely with software engineering team on system integration of payment systems, Point of sales, PLC control, 6 Axis robotic manipulation / Programming and deployment with full stack IoT application.   We are looking for candidate with personality specification : * Enthusiastic and creative in developing innovative solutions to solve real-world problems * Willing to cross train in multiple disciplines and keeping up to date on computer vision/ machine learning / AI solutions * Can do attitude with a positive mindset to work as a team player, divide and conquer, pushing boundaries and strive for excellence * Technology geeks welcome! * Work hard and play hard! * Divers, Racers, Formula 1 fanatics, Gamers, Risk takers get double points!
job_req: The responsibilities include but not limited to : >> Programming Denso VS series 6 axis robots, Delta motion controllers, Delta 6 axis Robots, Collaborative robots, System peripherals, PLC programming; * Building, configuring, and testing robots * Designing software systems to control their robotic systems, such as those robots used for robotic cafe , bars. * Designing automated robotic systems that are used to increase the production and precision levels * Analyzing and evaluating the prototypes and robotic systems that you have created * Reviewing and approving cost estimates and design calculations * Serving as technical support for the robotic systems you have created * Software programming skills (Java, Javascript (Server / Client) including Nodejs, Database, Python will be a bonus !! You are welcome to apply and joint our team !!

job_desc: Hyper Island Institute for Higher Education in Singapore is expanding! Over the past 5 years, we’ve seen over 5,000 individuals come through our doors to experience transformative learning in the areas of technology and change. Our impact is what drives us, and we’re on a journey to reinvent education and people development in Asia. We are looking for a passionate, inspiring and driven co-worker to join our team in Singapore. This person will be the Learning Designer in our Executive Education practice (70%) and the Learning Designer for our School (30%). As a Learning Designer in our Executive Education practice you design and deliver in-house learning programs for our partners, as well as manage the client relationships that come with them. As the Learning Designer for the School, you lead Long Term Programs and Open Courses. You’re a creative problem solver, highly collaborative and flexible in your ways of working, and you have a strong desire to facilitate, teach and mentor participants and students. You’ll be reporting to the Learning Design Director, and working closely with both the Learning Design Team and the Operations Team. Responsibilities (Executive Education - 70%)  Design ground breaking learning experiences for in-house, tailored projects and programs in Singapore 	and across Asia. Support the Partnership Manager in uncovering the Client’s learning gaps and needs, structure themand reframe into opportunities. Lead complex client relationships that are aimed at building long term sustainable learning programs for digital business transformation. Facilitate a wide variety of learning programs formats, where you are responsible for the overall 	choreography of the sessions, and able to converse and discuss with participants on the topics 	presented by Hyper Island or external collaborators. Continuously and actively observe, listen and identify learning gaps and opportunities during program 	delivery. Continuously explore, recruit, train and grow the network of Hyper Island’s collaborators, experts in the field who can provide expertise and an industry perspective in the learning programs. Have the potential to be and become a thought leader in an “ownable” topic (e.g. Growth Hacking, Design Thinking, Machine Learning, Digital Business Transformation, etc.) and deliver speaker sessions on that topic in our tailored learning programs.  Key to note: Occasional travel is required for delivery of learning programs in our Executive Education practice (40-50%). Responsibilities (School - 30%) On a monthly basis, our PTMA (Part-time Masters in Digital Management) Modules and our Open Courses take place in the School. The Learning designer contributes in the design, planning, project management and delivery of these programs, and works closely together with the Program Manager. Hands on facilitation of the student experience in the long and short programs through class room sessions or virtual sessions, group/team work, one to one meetings, and by being a class leader and role model for the students. Project manage, evaluate, follow up and improve on developed learning modules and content. Key to note: Occasional work in weekends required (PTMA teaching blocks are on Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. Teaching block takes place every 6-8 weeks throughout the academic year).
job_req: Marketing, design or business education preferred, as well as relevant work experience (5-10 years) in 	consulting (digital/brand/innovation/management), training or education. Passion for education and digital technologies/innovation/leadership. Proven track record in Digital Business Transformation in various shapes and forms. Excellent client management and project management skills. Confident on their feet and great storytelling abilities. Attention to detail and ability to self-organise. Native/near native English knowledge, Mandarin a plus.  Please send your resume to: Julie Beusmans, julie.beusmans@hyperisland.com. Only matching profiles will be contacted.
comp: HYPER ISLAND INSTITUTE OF HIGHER EDUCATION PTE. LTD.

job_desc: A Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering (EEE) is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. To support teaching and cutting-edge research, EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world. The research staff will work on using machine learning approaches to tackle challenges in wireless communications, such as blind signals classification and detection, and channel parameter estimation in constrained channels, etc. Responsibilities:  Developing machine learning algorithm to solve problems in wireless communications, especially for blind receiver. Testing the developed algorithms by using raw data. Presenting work progress and publishing research findings. Work closely with PI, team members and collaborators to ensure timely and efficient completion of project milestones.
job_req: Education background/ experience required:  PhD degree in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Electrical Engineering.  Specific Knowledge & Skills:  Strong foundation in wireless communication algorithms and optimization techniques. Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning techniques and algorithms, and open-source machine learning frameworks such as Keras and Tensorflow, etc. Familiarity with C/Python/Matlab language. Good English reading and writing skills. Good communication skills and ability to work in a team.  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_desc: About Dathena Science Dathena is a Swiss and Singaporean company developing data governance software based on machine learning algorithms. Dathena is the most complete and accurate data governance platform and is the only solution to easily classify and manage data with this level of accuracy while helping companies to comply with regulations. Using cutting edge machine learning technology, Dathena sift through all unstructured data allowing to regain full control on company’s information. Job Purpose As a Cloud Operations Engineer, you will maintain reliable infrastructure so that our R&D and Product Teams can build solutions that solve our clients and partners' hardest problems and can be counted on when they are needed most. You will work collaboratively with Software and A.I. engineers to understand what they need to get their jobs done. You care deeply about the availability and security of our systems, and configuration as code is your tool for ensuring that everything is operating as it should. Core Responsability  Manage and secure Linux-based cloud systems and networks at scale. Work with tools to automate critical aspects of production systems such as: configuration management and deployment of infrastructure. Maintain the stability and performance of the cloud platform. Utilize the latest industry standard tools and practices to meet the evolving needs of our internal engineers/developers and external clients/partners.
job_req: Technologies We Use  Languages: Python, Scala, and Java Systems Management: Terraform, Docker, Ansible, and Puppet Cloud Platforms: Azure, AWS and GCP Linux: CentOS (7)  What We Value  1-2 years experience in a similar role, or related technical field Coding/scripting fluency in at least one language and a commitment to automate solutions Experience with Linux systems from the kernel level and up Experience with configuration management solutions Ability to quickly take on new roles and responsibilities Track record of successfully deploying and running configuration management systems Desire to see features through from development to deployment in production environments

job_desc: The Tectus Dreamlab team pioneers the development of cutting-edge cross-platform apps in the engineering and construction sector. The flagship product, “Screening Eagle” Virtual Inspection Platform, is a holistic portal for asset monitoring, maintenance and inspection. We are a small but focused team that strives to transform traditional industries with technologies. Join us if you are independent, innovative and open to embrace the ambiguities of new technologies. As an algorithm engineer, you will be a critical team member and fully responsible for developing computer vision algorithms for our products. Responsibilities  Evaluate various machine learning (ML), deep learning (DL) and computer vision algorithms, and propose creative and efficient solutions accordingly; Design and develop ML/DL/computer vision algorithms for our applications in building and infrastructure assets inspection;  Optimise, maintain and test algorithm modules for real business cases;  Collaborate with other team members to implement algorithms from prototyping to production.
job_req: Basic Qualifications  PhD/Master/Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related technical fields; Familiar with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, CoreML, Caffe, and Keras; Strong skills in computer vision libraries such as openCV and PCL; Good experience in software engineering, with advanced programming skills in C/C++ and Python; Good knowledge of classifiers, regression and data mining; Solid linear algebra knowledge.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience in ML algorithms for vision problems; Experience in video analytics algorithms; Experience in ROS system and SLAM algorithms; Understanding of the 2D/3D graphics; Have personal projects at GitHub with 100+ stars.

job_desc: The National University of Singapore invites applications for the position of Research Assistant in the Department of Computer Science, School of Computing (SoC). SoC is strongly committed to research excellence in all its dimensions: Searching for fundamental results and insights, developing novel computational solutions to a wide range of applications, building large-scale experimental systems and improving the wellbeing of society. We seek to play an active role both internationally and locally in the core and emerging areas of Computer Science and Information Systems. The Research Assistant will be responsible for working closely with the Principal Investigator and lab members on one or more research projects. He/she should possess experience and interest in the following research areas:  Artificial Intelligence, machine learning Probabilistic models and inference algorithms Decision making under uncertainty, e.g., Markov decision process (MDP) and partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP)  Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.
job_req: A Bachelor’s degree with Honours or a Master’s degree in the relevant area; and Experience in research.  Applicants with prior publications in the relevant area will be considered favourably.

job_desc: The project focuses on optimizing medical resource and appointment scheduling. The project aims to develop patient and resource models for medical appointment scheduling, and design intelligent methods and strategies for scheduling medical appointments and resources with various optimization criteria. We aim to model the treatment plans of patients as workflows and exploit workflow scheduling algorithms in distributed computing for scheduling medical resources and appointments in a coordinated and intelligent manner. We also aim to exploit data analytics, machine learning and advanced simulation techniques to predict uncertainty in medical appointments and develop robust scheduling algorithms for achieving high patient throughput while minimizing demand spikes.
job_req: Candidates are expected to conduct high-quality research on algorithm design and analysis, performance evaluation, and software prototype development. Applicant should have a minimum qualification of Doctorate degree in Computer Science or any related field. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_desc: We are a group of scientists and engineers who use our technologies to solve real world problems. We understand data and products. We live with data, collecting, analysing and using data, help user to find their favourite items, detect patterns and mining interesting results. We stand on the wave of AI revolution, using latest techniques to build products. This is a position that need continuously study and problem solving.   Job Description:  Analyse data from various sources, find patterns and provide solutions Write high-quality, clean, elegant, and reusable code; build common libraries Build high performance, high availability, scalability, and easy to maintain services Communicate with other team, deep understand data from different sources and product architecture, optimise the data process pipeline Design and implement various supporting tools as needed
job_req: Requirements:  More than 3 years of relevant experience Passionate about coding and programming, innovation, and solving challenging problems Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields In-depth understanding of data structures and other computer science fundamentals Hands-on experience in at least one of the programming languages: Go, Python or C++ Machine learning algorithms such as clustering, classification algorithms and data processing tools such as tensorflow, scikit    Skills below are optional but preferable:  Hands-on experience in distributed data platforms and processing frameworks such as Hadoop, Spark, Map-Reduce Hands-on experience in Linux development environments and Shell Scripting

job_desc: We have a one-year Research Fellow position for the research work of microwave imaging using machine learning and holographic phase encryption.   Expect to develop algorithms for microwave imaging and apply machine learning to improve their performance.   Expect to combine wave physics with machine learning, rather than a “black-box” way of applying machine learning.   Expected to develop robust phase retrieval algorithms and apply them to holographic phase encryption.   Expected to study the sensitivity and complexity of security keys for the designed nanoscale security infrastructures.
job_req: Possess a PhD degree in electronic information science and technology or related fields, specializing in electromagnetics or acoustics.   Experienced in computational electromagnetics and inverse scattering problems. Proficient in microwave imaging techniques and signal processing techniques.   Experienced in numerical methods of electromagnetic scattering theory including method of moment, discrete dipole approximation, finite-element method, and boundary element method.   Having experience in basic machine learning.   Working experience of at least one year.   Extensive use of electromagnetic simulation software, such as GPR-MAX.   Open to fixed term contract.

job_desc: My client, one of world's leading trading firm, is looking for a Quant Analyst with 2-7 years of experience.   Job Responsibilities In this role, you will be working closely with PM, deeply involved in the development of systematic trading strategies. job_desc: About Us Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017. The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure’s technology literally in the driver’s seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love. For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet here. Digital Marketing Team at Pure The Pure Storage Global Digital Marketing team is focused on supporting hyper growth, geographic expansion, and delivering world-class, dynamic, and intelligent online experiences that engage and delight our prospects, customers, partners, and employees globally. The team is focused on optimising every digital touchpoint and conversion trigger to grow revenue. We’re looking for a passionate digital marketing leader for our innovative Digital Marketing team. The team is responsible for global paid and organic search, paid media, social media marketing, purestorage.com and the digital analytics that ties it all together. The Digital Marketing team will also be responsible for capturing demand gen best practices and piloting innovation opportunities for marketing. This individual will be responsible for planning and optimising Pure’s paid digital media, demand generation, and the company’s social media programmes in APJ (Asia-Pacific and Japan). In this role, you will support our efforts to drive demand and multi-million-dollar pipeline through APJ paid media, social media, and web experiences optimised to accelerate conversions and drive incremental revenue. You will oversee and manage social and media agency relationships and be responsible for working with agency partners and Pure’ analytics suite to track and report on digital media performance. You will work closely with the global digital marketing team, theater program marketing, and field marketing to develop a digital media strategy that aligns with business goals and drives demand for the theatre. We are looking for a team member who has a proven track record of rolling up their sleeves to get the work done, thrives on analysis to refine how to optimise and has a global mindset. This role will pioneer new approaches and tactics by contributing to enterprise-wide digital strategies, and new approaches to brand storytelling.  This position is based in Singapore or Tokyo, Japan and will report to the Head of the Global Demand Centre. What You Will Be Doing WEB?  Collaborate with APJ programs and field marketing teams on the strategy and planning of APJ digital media programmes including paid search, programmatic media, and retargeting, paid & organic social, and content syndication. Work with appointed media and social agencies to lead the execution, reporting, and ongoing optimisation of these media programmes. Design and execute digital media plans that are aligned with the prospect and/or customer’s journey Work closely with colleagues in the Global Demand Center to define audience segmentation needs for the theatre, plan and execute targeted programs using data intelligence, track digital lead quality and provide feedback on BoM for digital activities. Work with agencies and internal analytics to set-up digital tracking needs and consolidate reporting to showcase digital media performance for the APJ theater. Work hands-on with the Pure Storage “marchitecture” in the region. Currently including (not limited to) SFDC, Tableau, Adobe Analytics & Marketo. Partner with key stakeholders, including APJ Leadership and field marketing managers, Digital Team, Product Marketing, Campaigns, Partner, Customer References and Corporate teams to ensure purestorage.com is optimised as a frictionless, localised and personalised experience to accelerate conversions and deliver measurable business results in APJ.
